    　　保安万灵丹 【《准绳》，下同】 　发散一切痈疽瘰疬内蕴之毒。　　全蝎　石斛　明天麻　当归　甘草炙　川芎　羌活　荆芥穗　防风　麻黄去节　北细辛　川乌汤泡，去皮　草乌汤泡，去皮尖　何首乌各一两　明雄黄六钱　茅朮八两　　右为细末，炼蜜丸弹子大，每药一两分作四丸，一两作六丸，一两作九丸，三等做下，以备年岁老壮、病势缓急取用。预用朱砂六钱，研细为衣，磁罐收贮。用时以连须、大葱白九枝，煎汤一茶锺，将药一丸，乘热化开，通口服尽，被盖出汗为效。如服后汗迟，再用葱白汤催之，后必汗如淋洗，渐渐退下覆盖衣物，其汗自收自敛，患者自然爽快，其病如失。但病未成者，随即消去；已成者，随即高肿溃脓。如诸病无表证相兼，不必发散者，只用热酒化服。[65p]

    Baohan Wanling Dan

    Dissolves the toxins hidden within all abscesses, boils, and swellings.

    Ingredients:

    • Whole scorpion
    • Dendrobium
    • Bright Tianma
    • Angelica
    • Honey-fried licorice
    • Chuanxiong
    • Qianggo
    • Schizonepeta spikes
    • Fangfeng
    • Ephedra, without joints
    • Northern Asarum
    • Chuanwu, soaked in soup and peeled
    • Cao Wu, soaked in soup and peeled
    • He Shou Wu, each one liang (about 37.5 grams)
    • Bright realgar, six qian (about 18.75 grams)
    • Moutan, eight liang (about 300 grams)

    Grind the above into a fine powder and refine into pills the size of a marble. Each ingredient of one liang is made into four pills, one liang into six pills, and one liang into nine pills, in three proportions, to prepare for future use depending on age and severity of the illness.

    In advance, use six qian of cinnabar, finely ground for coating, and store in a magnetic jar. When using, boil nine stalks of green onion whites in a tea cup of water, then add one pill of the medicine, dissolve it hot, and take it orally completely. Cover and induce sweating as an effect. If sweating is slow after taking, use green onion soup to promote it, and sweating will follow as if showered. Gradually remove covering clothing; the sweat will self-consolidate, and the patient will feel refreshed, as if the illness has vanished. However, if the illness is not fully developed, it will immediately dissipate; if it has formed, it will swell and burst with pus.

    For cases without accompanying exterior symptoms that do not require dispersing, simply take with hot wine.[65p]

    　　蟾酥丸　治前证。
    　　蟾酥二钱，酒化　轻粉五分　枯矾　寒水石煅　铜绿　滴乳香　明没药　胆矾　麝香各一钱　雄黄　朱砂各一钱　蜗牛二十一个　以上各为末，秤准，于端午日午时，在净室中先将蜗牛研烂，再同蟾酥和研稠粘，方入各药共捣极匀，丸如菉豆大，每服三丸，用葱白五寸，患者自嚼烂，吐于男左女右手心，包药在内，用无灰热酒一茶杯送下，被盖，如人行五六里，出汗为效。甚者再进一服。应于清静处，修合，妇人鸡犬等忌见。[66p]

    To treat the previous symptoms with the toad venom pill:

    Take two qian of toad venom, half a fen of powdered light mineral transformed with wine, and one qian each of dry alum, calcined cold water stone, copper green, dripping frankincense, clear myrrh, bile mineral, musk, realgar, and cinnabar. Also, use twenty-one snails. Grind all these ingredients into a fine powder. Weigh them accurately, and on the noon of the Dragon Boat Festival, first grind the snails into a paste in a pure room, then mix them with the toad venom until thick and sticky. Next, combine all the prepared medicines and pound them thoroughly until uniform. Form the mixture into pills the size of a broad bean. Take three pills at a time, using five inches of green onion stalk, which the patient should chew thoroughly and then spit out onto the palm of the left hand for men and the right hand for women, wrapping the pills inside. Consume with a tea cup of hot wine without ash, and after taking it, walk about five or six li until sweating occurs, indicating effectiveness. In severe cases, another dose may be taken. This should be done in a quiet place, focusing on calmness; women and chickens or dogs should not be present.[66p]

    Death-Defying Pill for Pre-Crisis Conditions.

    Victory Gold Pill for Pre-Crisis Conditions.

    A grain of golden elixir treats previous symptoms.

    The Immortal Life-Saving Decoction, also known as the True Person’s Life-Saving Decoction, treats all kinds of sores. If not yet purulent, it helps internal reabsorption; if it has formed pus, it assists in bursting the abscess and also alleviates pain and disinfects effectively.

    Powder frankincense, protective wind herb, white atractylodes, Sichuan fritillary bulb, red peony root, angelica tail, myrrh, fried soap pod thorn, flower pollen, licorice root, and pangolin shell, each one part; dried tangerine peel and honeysuckle, each three parts. Use ten cups of undiluted liquor for larger sores, five cups for smaller ones, and place it in a bottle with a narrow mouth, sealing it tightly with thick paper to prevent air leakage. Boil down to three large cups, strain, and take three doses. Continue without interruption, taking doses according to the condition of the sore. For those who can drink alcohol, they may consume three to five cups after taking the medicine. This remedy contains no alcoholic odor, does not upset the organs, and does not harm qi and blood. Avoid sour beverages, thin wines, and iron utensils. After taking, lie on one side; if pain subsides, recovery is assured. The power of this method is immense, beyond imagination.[68p]

    Wuxiang San treats stubborn lumps that do not dissolve, scrofula, and swelling from wind toxin.

    Ingredients:

    • 1 tael of each: Mu Xiang (Wood Fragrance), Ji She Xiang (Chicken Tongue Fragrance), Chen Xiang (Agarwood)
    • 2.5 qian of powdered Musk
    • 2 taels each of: She Gan (Belamcanda), Xun Lu Xiang (Incense), Gan Ge (Ge Gen), Sheng Ma (Cimicifuga), Du Huo (Syzygium), Lian Qiao (Forsythia), Sang Ji Sheng (Mulberry Misteltoe), and Gan Cao (Licorice)
    • 3 taels of Da Huang (Rhubarb), crushed and lightly toasted

    Crush the above ingredients and mix them with the powdered Musk. Take 3 qian per dose, mixed in one medium cup of water, decoct until one-third remains. Strain, add half a cup of bamboo juice, and decoct again until boiling once or twice. Take warm, three times a day.

    Lian Qiao San treats swelling of the lymph nodes above the neck.

    Ingredients:

    • 1 tael each of: Lian Qiao, She Gan, Du Huo, Chuan Sheng Ma, Mu Xiang, Chen Xiang, and Mu Tong (Clematis)
    • 0.5 taels of Sang Ji Sheng (Mulberry Mistletoe) and Ding Xiang (Clove)
    • 2 taels of Chuan Da Huang (Rhubarb), crushed and lightly toasted

    Grind the above into a fine powder. Take 2 qian per dose, mixed with congee, three times a day.

    Du Huo San treats stubborn lumps, wind knots, toxic swelling, and feelings of heat and tightness in the limbs.

    Ingredients:

    • 1 tael each of: Du Huo, Mu Xiang, She Gan, Sang Ji Sheng, Lian Qiao, Sheng Ma, Chen Xiang, Da Huang (fresh), and Gan Cao (fresh)

    Crush the above, taking 4 qian per dose, mixed in one medium cup of water, decoct until six-tenths remains. Strain, add half a cup of bamboo juice, and decoct again until boiling once or twice. Take warm, three times a day, for best effect.[71p]

    　　清肝益荣汤　治肝胆小肠经风热血燥，筋挛结核，或耳项胸乳胁肋作痛，或作瘊子，并一切肝火之证。　　山栀　当归　木瓜不犯铁器　茯苓各一钱　柴胡　川芎　芍药炒，各七分　熟地黄一钱半　白朮二钱　龙胆草八分　炙甘草五分　　右姜水煎服。

    Qing Gan Yi Rong Decoction: Used to treat wind-heat and dryness in the liver, gallbladder, and small intestine meridians, muscle cramps, nodules, pain in the ears, neck, chest, or side, as well as warts and all symptoms of liver fire. Ingredients:

    Yi Qi Yang Rong Decoction: Used to treat depression and weakened qi and blood from overwork, swelling and hardness in the neck or limbs, or softness without redness or pain, slight fever in the afternoon, or lesions that do not close. Ingredients:

    • Ginseng (3 grams)

    Xia Ku Cao Decoction is for treating scrofula and chronic ulcers, regardless of whether they have burst or not, whether they are recent or longstanding.

    Use six taels of Xia Ku Cao with two sheng of water, simmer until reduced to seven parts, strain, and take on an empty stomach. This is a sacred remedy for scrofula. If the condition is very severe, prepare a concentrated decoction to take and also apply it to the affected area; taking it frequently is beneficial. Additionally, using the Ten Full Replenishing Decoction with added Xiang Fu Zi, Bei Mu, and Yuan Zhi is particularly effective.

    Shen Xiao Secret Powder is for treating scrofula. If pills cannot be taken or do not work, it is advisable to use this medicine, along with blood-nourishing herbs.

    Use twenty-one chi of the insect Chan Miao, removing the head, feet, and wings, stir-fried with glutinous rice, then remove the rice. Also, use two qian each of Jing Jie and fried silkworms, and one qian of fried black nightshade. Grind them all into a fine powder and mix well. Take one qian each time, mixing it with warm wine at five in the morning.

    Evil substances will be expelled from the body through urination by noon. If urination is painful or difficult, it is advisable to drink green onion tea or Mu Tong decoction to facilitate this, and then eat rice porridge to replenish. If it does not work, take the remedy again at five in the morning the next day, and it will surely expel the substances. However, if the pulse is tight and weak, it should not be taken.[73p]

    　　时效针头散　追蚀恶疮瘀肉。

    　　琥珀膏　治瘰疬肿硬，或穿破，脓水不绝，经久不瘥，致成痿疾及痈疽，并贴之，更服益气养荣等汤。　　琥珀　丁香　木香各三钱　桂心半两　白芷　朱砂细研　当归　防风去芦　木鳖子去壳　木通各半两　黄丹七两　柳枝三两　松脂二两　内除琥珀、丁香、桂心、朱砂、木香，为细末，余药銼咀，以麻油一斤二两浸五日，入锅中，以慢火熬，候白芷焦色，滤去滓，下松脂末及黄丹，以柳枝不住手搅，滴水中试软硬，如软再煎，得中，方入琥珀等末搅匀，用磁器盛贮，用时旋摊。[74p]

    Effective Needle Ointment: It disperses and treats quiescent sores and necrotic flesh.

    Ingredients: 1 tael of red stone resin, 2 qian each of myrrh and white clove, 1 qian each of realgar and yellow earth, along with light powder, musk, and one centipede (roasted). Grind them into a fine powder and apply to the necrotic flesh. If the sore is small, apply directly to the sore itself, allowing the flesh to slough off naturally. Additionally, apply a medicinal plaster to facilitate the removal of flesh. It has been found effective to use 2 qian of powdered realgar mixed with 2 qian of powdered alum and blended well; using 1 qian of alum with the same medicine also yields results, though not as rapidly as with realgar.

    Amber Ointment: This treats scrofula, hardened swellings, or when they have ruptured with pus that does not cease, leading to atrophy or abscesses. Apply it and also take tonifying and nourishing decoctions.

    Ingredients: 3 qian each of amber, clove, and sandalwood, ½ tael of cassia bark, ½ tael each of angelica, white marshmallow (peeled), cubebs (peeled), and houttuynia, 7 taels of yellow earth, 3 taels of willow twigs, and 2 taels of pine resin.

    Preparation: Exclude amber, clove, cassia bark, red mercury, and sandalwood, and grind them into a fine powder. The remaining medicines should be ground and chopped. Soak in 1 tael and 2 qian of sesame oil for five days. Place in a pot and simmer over low heat until the white marshmallow turns a burnt color. Strain out the dregs, add powdered pine resin and yellow earth, continuously stirring with willow twigs. Test the softness in water; if too soft, continue simmering until just right. Finally, mix in the powdered amber and others until well combined, store in a ceramic container, and apply as needed.[74p]

    　　连翘散坚汤 【东垣，下同】 　治耳下至缺盆，或至肩上生疮，坚硬如石，动之无根者，名马刀疮，从手足少阳经中来也。或生两胁，或已流脓作疮，或未破，并皆治之。

    Lianqiao Sanjian Decoction

    For treating sores that develop from the ear down to the hollow of the shoulder, or to the shoulders, which are hard like stone, and do not have a root when moved, named "Madao sore," originating from the hand and foot Shaoyang channels. These sores may appear on the flanks, may have already ruptured and discharged pus, or may not have broken yet, and all should be treated.

    Ingredients:

    • Donggui (Angelica sinensis) washed in wine
    • Huangqin (Scutellaria baicalensis)
    • Lianqiao (Forsythia suspensa)
    • E’suan washed in wine and lightly fried
    • Sanleng (Sparganii rhizoma) washed in wine and lightly fried, each 0.5 taels
    • Tuguagen (Bitter gourd root) fried in wine, 1 tael
    • Caolongdan (Gentiana scabra) washed in wine, 1 tael
    • Chaihu (Bupleurum chinense), 1 tael and 2 qian
    • Huangqin fried in wine, 0.7 taels
    • Zhi gancao (Honey-fried licorice), 0.6 taels
    • Huanglian (Coptis chinensis) washed in wine, 0.3 taels
    • Cangzhu (Atractylodes lancea), 0.3 taels
    • Shaoyao (Paeonia lactiflora), 0.2 taels

    Preparation: Take half of the ingredients and grind them into a fine powder, then refine honey into pills the size of mung beans; take one hundred pills, or one hundred and fifty pills each time. The other half should be chewed, taking half a tael with eight parts water; soak for half a day, then boil, remove the dregs, and take while hot. When lying down, keep the head lower than the feet, lie without a pillow, swallow ten times with each mouthful, leave one mouthful to take the pills. After taking, lie down comfortably as usual.[75p]

    　　升阳调经汤　治瘰疬绕颈，或至颊车，此证足阳明胃经中来也。若其疮深远，隐曲肉低，是足少阴肾中来也。是戊土传癸水，夫传妻，俱作块子坚硬，大小不等，并皆治之。或作丸服，亦得。　　升麻八钱　葛根　草龙胆酒制　黄芩酒制　　荗酒洗，炒　京三棱酒洗，炒　炙甘草　连翘　黄连酒洗　桔梗各五钱　生黄芩四钱　归梢　芍药各三钱　黄蘗酒洗，二钱　知母酒洗，炒，一两　　右，秤一半作丸，炼蜜丸如菉豆大，每服一百丸，或一百五十丸；一半(口父)咀，每服半两，若能食大便硬，可旋加至七八钱止，水二盏，先浸半日，煎至一盏，去滓热服。卧身，脚在高处，去枕头，噙一口，作十次咽之，留一口在后，送下丸子。服药毕，卧如常，此治法也。[76p]

    Shengyang T调Jing Decoction

    This treats scrofula around the neck or extending to the cheek, which indicates that this condition stems from the foot yangming stomach channel. If the sores are deep and hidden, with low protrusions of flesh, it indicates a source in the foot shaoyin kidney. This is the transformation of earth into water, akin to the relationship between husband and wife, resulting in hard lumps of varying sizes, all of which should be treated. It can also be taken as pills.

    Ingredients:

    • 8 qian of Shengma (Herb)
    • Ge Gen (Kudzu Root)
    • Cao Longdan (Gentian) prepared with liquor
    • Huangqin (Scutellaria) prepared with liquor
    • Radix et Rhizoma Ligustici (Szechuan Lovage) washed in liquor, then stir-fried
    • Jing Sanleng (Dandelion) washed in liquor, then stir-fried
    • Honey-fried Licorice
    • Lianqiao (Forsythia)
    • Huanglian (Coptis) washed in liquor
    • Ji Qi (Platycodon) each 5 qian
    • Fresh Huangqin 4 qian
    • Gui Shao (Angelica) and Shao Yao (Peony) each 3 qian
    • Huangbo (Phellodendron) washed in liquor, 2 qian
    • Zhimu (Anemarrhena) washed in liquor, then stir-fried, totaling 1 liang

    From the above ingredients, take half, make into pills the size of a mung bean, take 100 or 150 pills; the other half can be chewed, each time taking half a liang. If one can eat hard stools, the dosage may be increased to 7 or 8 qian at most. Use 2 sheng of water, soaking for half a day, then simmering down to 1 sheng. Strain and take warm. Lie down with feet elevated, remove the pillow, hold a mouthful and swallow ten times, leaving one mouthful behind to assist in swallowing the pills. After taking the medicine, lie down as usual; this is the treatment method.[76p]

    　　散肿溃坚汤　治马刀疮，结硬如石，在耳下至缺盆，或至肩上，或至胁下，皆手足少阳经中；及瘰疬遍下颏，或至颊车，坚而不溃，在足阳明经中所出；或二疮已破，及流脓水，并皆治之。服药多少，临病斟酌，量病人饮食多少，大便硬软，以意消息之。　　柴胡梢四钱　草龙胆酒炒　黄蘗去粗皮，酒炒　知母炒　花粉酒洗　昆布去土　桔梗各半两　甘草梢炙　京三棱酒炒　　荗酒洗，炒　连翘　黄连各二钱　升麻六钱　黄芩梢八钱，一半酒洗，炒，一半生用。　　右(口父)咀，每服六钱或七钱，水二盏，先浸半日，煎至一盏，去滓稍热服，于卧处伸脚在高处，头微低，每噙一口，作十次咽，至服毕，依常安卧，取药在胸中停留故也。另攒半料作细末，炼蜜为丸，如菉豆大，每服一百丸，此汤留一口送下。更加海藻半两炒食，后量虚实加减多少服，皆仿此例。一方有当归、白芍各二钱。若蜜丸，即名散肿溃坚丸。[77p]

    San Chong Hui Jian Decoction

    This treats horse knife sores that are hard and firm as stone, found from beneath the ear to the hollow of the clavicle, or reaching the shoulder, or beneath the ribs, all part of the lesser yang meridian. Also applies to lymphatic swelling below the chin, or to the buccal area, where the sores are hard and do not ulcerate, encountered in the foot yangming meridian; or in cases where two sores have already ruptured and are draining pus, all can be treated with this.

    Dosage of the medicine should be adjusted based on the condition, considering the patient's dietary intake, and the consistency of their stools, referring to their condition.

    • Chai Hu Shoots: 4 pennies
    • Grass Gentian, stir-fried in wine: 1 amount
    • Huang Bo, with rough skin removed, stir-fried in wine: 1 amount
    • Zhi Mu, stir-fried: 1 amount
    • Flower Powder, washed in wine: 1 amount
    • Kun Bu, cleaned of soil: 1 amount
    • Jie Geng: 0.5 amounts
    • Gan Cao Shoots, roasted: 1 amount
    • Jing San Ling, stir-fried in wine: 1 amount
    • Qian Jin (a type of alcohol): washed and stir-fried: 1 amount
    • Lian Qiao: 0.2 amounts
    • Huang Lian: 0.2 amounts
    • Sheng Ma: 0.6 amounts
    • Huang Qin Shoots: 0.8 amounts, half washed in wine and stir-fried, half used fresh.

    For usage, take it in a fine powder, each dose should be about 6 or 7 pennies with 2 cups of water, soaked for half a day, and boiled down to one cup. After straining, it should be taken slightly warm while lying down, with feet elevated, head slightly lowered, and swallowed in ten gulps after taking each mouthful. Following the dosage, remain lying comfortably to allow the medicine to settle in the chest.

    Another preparation involves making a fine powder, refining honey into pills the size of mung beans, taking one hundred pills for each dose, while this decoction retains a mouthful to swallow down. Additionally, consider adding half an amount of seaweed stir-fried for quantity adjustments based on the patient's condition, following the aforementioned guidelines.

    There is also a version including 2 pennies each of Dang Gui and Bai Shao. If formed into honey pills, it is then named San Chong Hui Jian Wan.[77p]

    　　救苦胜灵丹汤　治马刀挟瘿者，从耳下或耳后，下至颈至肩上，或入缺盆中者，乃手足少阳经之分野，受心脾之邪而作也。今将二证合治之。　　黄芪一钱，护皮毛，实腠理，及活血，又实表补元气，乃疮家之圣药也　人参三分，补肺气，如气短及不调而喘者，加之　真漏芦半钱，勿以白头翁代之　升麻一钱　葛根半钱，此三味俱足阳明本经药　甘草半钱，能调中和诸药，泻火益胃　连翘一钱，此味乃十二经疮中之药不可无者，能散血结气聚，此疮家之神药也　丹皮二分，去肠胃中留滞宿血　熟地黄三分，此三味诸经中和血生血凉血药也　当归身三分　生地黄三分　白芍药三分，如夏月倍之，其味酸，其气寒，能补中益气，治腹痛，如冬月寒证勿用　肉桂三分，大辛热，能散结聚。如阴证疮疡少用之，此寒因热用之意。[78p]

    Rescue from Suffering Superior Elixir

    To treat cases where a sword or knife wound leads to goiter, often appearing below the ear or behind it, extending down to the neck and shoulders, or even entering the axilla, these issues are associated with the hand and foot Shaoyang meridians, arising from evils affecting the heart and spleen. Now, we will combine the two conditions for treatment.

    Ingredients:

    • Astragalus (Huangqi) 1 qian: Protects the skin and hair, strengthens the pores, activates blood, and replenishes vital energy; it is a sacred medicine for wounds.
    • Ginseng (Renshen) 3 fen: Nourishes lung qi, especially for shortness of breath or unregulated panting; add half a qian of True Reed (Zhenloulu), do not substitute with White-headed Crane (Baitouweng).
    • Cimicifuga (Shengma) 1 qian.
    • Kudzu root (Gegen) 0.5 qian: These three herbs correspond to the Yangming channel and are essential.
    • Licorice (Gancao) 0.5 qian: Harmonizes the middle, balances all other ingredients, dispels fire, and benefits the stomach.
    • Forsythia (Lianqiao) 1 qian: This herb is indispensable for wounds in the twelve channels; it disperses blood stasis and gathers qi—an essential medicine for wounds.
    • Moutan bark (Danpi) 2 fen: Eliminates stagnant blood in the intestines and stomach.
    • Cooked Rehmannia (Shudihuang) 3 fen: These three ingredients among the channels harmonize, generate, and cool blood.
    • Angelica root (Danggui) 3 fen.
    • Fresh Rehmannia (Shengdi) 3 fen.
    • White Peony (Baishao) 3 fen: Increase the dosage in summer; it has a sour taste and cold properties, capable of replenishing and benefiting qi, treating abdominal pain. Do not use during cold conditions in winter.
    • Cinnamon (Rougui) 3 fen: Very pungent and warm, it dispels lumps and stagnation. Use sparingly for cold conditions affecting ulcers; this action is intended for conditions where cold arises from heat.[78p]

    又为阴寒覆盖，其疮用大辛热去之，烦躁者勿用之　柴胡功同连翘，如疮不在少阳经，勿用　鼠粘子三分，无肿不用　京三棱炮，二分　昆布二分，味咸，若疮坚硬甚者用之，咸能软坚也　　荗三分，此二味疮坚硬甚者用之，不硬者勿用　羌活　独活　防风各一钱，三味必关手足太阳证，脊痛项强，不可回顾，腰似折项似拔者　防风辛温，如疮在膈上，虽无手足太阳经证，亦当用之，为能散结去上部风邪故也　神曲炒，二分，食不消化者用之　益智仁二分，如唾多者胃不和也，或吐沫吐食，胃中寒者加之，无则勿用　麦芽一钱，消食健脾　黄蘗炒，三分，如有热或腿脚无力加之。如烦躁欲去衣者，此胃中伏火也，更宜加之　黄连炒，三分，治烦闷　厚朴姜制，一钱二分，如腹胀加之　　右共为细末，汤浸蒸饼，捏作饼子，晒干，捣如米粒大，每服三钱，白汤下。[79p]

    When covered by cold and yin, use large pungent and hot substances to treat sores; those with agitation should not use this. Chaihu works similarly to Lianqiao; if the sore is not located in the Shaoyang channels, do not use it. Three parts of Mouchanzizi; do not use if there is no swelling. Two parts of Jing Sanling Pao. Two parts of Kunbu, which has a salty flavor; if the sore is very hard, use this, as salt can soften hard issues. Three parts of Xuan; these two ingredients are for very hard sores; do not use if not hard. One qian each of Qianghuo, Duhuo, and Fangfeng; these three must address the hand and foot Taiyang symptoms, spine pain, and stiffness in the neck, where one cannot look back, and the waist feels like it's broken and the neck feels like it's pulled. Fangfeng is hot and pungent; if the sore is above the diaphragm, even without Taiyang symptoms, it should still be used to dispel congestion and upper body wind evil. Two parts of Shenqu, fried, for those with undigested food. Two parts of Yizhiren; if there is excessive salivation, it indicates stomach disharmony or vomiting saliva and food; if there is cold in the stomach, add this; if not, do not use. One qian of Malt, for digestion and strengthening the spleen. Three parts of Huangbo, fried; if there is heat or weakness in the legs, add this. If one feels restless and wants to remove their clothes, this indicates concealed fire in the stomach, so it’s advisable to add this. Three parts of Huanglian, fried; it treats irritability. One qian and two parts of Houpu, processed with ginger; if there is abdominal distension, add this.

    Combine all the above into a fine powder, soak it in broth, steam into cakes, pinch into small pieces, dry them, and pound them to the size of rice grains. Take three qian with warm water.[79p]

    如气不顺加橘红，甚者加木香少许，量病人虚实消息之，毋令药多妨其饮食，此治之大法也。如止在阳明分者，去柴胡、鼠粘子二味，余皆用之。如在少阳，分为马刀挟瘿，去独活、漏芦、升麻、葛根，加瞿麦三分。如本人气素弱，其病势来时气盛而不短促者，宜作气盛而从病变治之，权也。加黄芩、黄连、黄蘗、知母、防己，视邪气在上中下而用之。[80p]

    If there is an obstruction in the qi, add tangerine peel; in severe cases, add a little musk. Assess the patient's condition of deficiency or excess, and do not let the medicine hinder their diet—this is the fundamental method of treatment. If the condition is limited to the Yangming region, remove the herbs Chaihu and Shucangzi, and use all others. If it is in the Shaoyang region, divide it into sections like a horse’s hoof with a goiter, removing Du Huo, Lou Lu, Sheng Ma, and Ge Gen, while adding three fen of Qumai. If the patient’s qi is typically weak but the illness manifests with strong qi that is not short and quick, then treat it as strong qi while following the changes of the illness. Add Huangqin, Huanglian, Huangbo, Zhimu, and Fangji, depending on whether the pathogenic influence is above, middle, or below.[80p]

    假令在上焦，加黄芩半酒洗，半生用；在中焦，加黄连半酒洗，半生；在下焦，加酒制黄蘗、知母、防己之类，选而用之。如大便不通而邪盛者，加酒制大黄以利之。如血燥而大便干燥者，加桃仁泥、大黄。如风结燥不行者，加麻仁、大黄以润之。如风濇而大便不行，加煨皂角仁、大黄、秦艽以利之。如脉濇，觉身有气濇而大便不通者，加(木郁)李仁、大黄以除风燥。如阴寒证为寒结秘而大便不通者，以局方半硫丸，或加炮附子、干姜煎，候冰冷服之。大抵用药之法，不惟疮疡，凡诸疾病气素怯弱者，当去苦寒之剂，多加人参、黄芪、甘草之类，以泻火而补元气，余皆仿此。[81p]

    If it is in the upper burner, add half a measure of Huangqin and wash with half a measure of wine, then use half raw; in the middle burner, add half a measure of Huanglian and wash with half a measure of wine, then use half raw; in the lower burner, add wine-prepared Huangbo, Zhimu, and Fangji, selected and used accordingly. If there is constipation and an excess of pathogenic factors, add wine-prepared Dahuang to promote bowel movement. If there is dryness of blood and hard stools, add peach kernel paste and Dahuang. If there is wind causing dryness and blockages, add hemp seed and Dahuang to moisten. If there is wind with hot conditions causing constipation, add roasted soapberry kernel, Dahuang, and Qinjiao to promote bowel movement. If the pulse is thin and one feels sluggish and has constipation, add (Mu Yu) Li kernel and Dahuang to dispel wind and dryness. If there is a cold yin condition resulting in a cold obstruction and constipation, use the prescribed formula with half a mercury pill, or add roasted Aconite and dried ginger in decoction, waiting until cool to take. Generally, in the method of using medicine, not only for sores but for all diseases with weak qi, one should reduce bitter and cold medicinals and increase ginseng, Huangqi, and licorice to drain fire and replenish primal qi; the rest should follow this principle.[81p]

    Chai Hu Tong Jing Decoction: Treats sores on the sides of a child’s neck, hardened and unbroken, known as "horse knife," and also treats scrofula.     Taiyi Ointment - An effective treatment for ulcers.

    Myrrh - 4 qian,
    Clear oil - 1 jin,
    Yellow lead - 5 liang,
    Musk - 3 qian,
    Calamine - 2 qian,
    Frankincense - 2 qian,
    Brain paste - 1 qian.

    Mix the clear oil and yellow lead to make an ointment, stirring with a willow branch. Add in 7 green onions, continuing to stir until they are fully incorporated. Maintain the stirring over low heat until it reaches a point where it doesn't disperse when water drips into it. Then mix in the frankincense, myrrh, brain paste, musk, and calamine evenly, and store it in porcelain.

    Kexiao Powder - For the treatment of previous symptoms.

    Forty-nine centipedes, without removing their wings or legs, fried;
    Forty-nine grains of glutinous rice;
    Forty-nine red beans;
    Half qian of cassia and mercury.

    Grind these five ingredients into a fine powder. Start by taking one character, then two, then three, and finally four characters, washing it down with a decoction of the Cinnamomum and willow root. Take it on an empty stomach and it should work by promoting urination and relieving symptoms. If you experience nausea or vomit yellow bile, it is no problem; the ulcers will gradually dissipate.

    Yuzhu Powder - Dissolves ulcers, nourishes blood, and regulates menstruation.

    Angelica, peony, rhubarb, licorice, cooked rehmannia, mirabilite, scutellaria, and chuanxiong, all in equal parts.

    Grind these into a coarse powder. Take 3 qian, mix it with one cup of water, and three slices of fresh ginger. Boil until reduced to about 70%, then strain and drink warm. Take once daily for seven to eight days for effect.[83p]

    Qianghuo Lianqiao Decoction: Treats the initial onset of scrofula, with symptoms of chills, fever, swelling, and pain.     Yang's Family Secret Recipe: Treats scrofula. Ingredients: 28 beetles (removing heads, wings, and feet), stir-fried with glutinous rice, plus 2 qian each of Jingjiesui, Bai Jiangcan, and Black Qianniuzi. Grind these into a powder. At bedtime, take 1 qian of talcum powder mixed with rice drink; take another dose at midnight; and at dawn, use warm wine to mix with 1 to 2 or 3 qian of the medicine, adjusting for strength. After taking, if there are no foul substances in urination, take another dose the following morning.     Yan's Three Saints Pill: Treats scrofula.
    Fifty cloves, ten wasps, and one tael of musk powder. Grind these into a fine powder. Soak fifty grains of salt and fermented soybeans, then grind them into a mud-like paste. Mix with the previous ingredients to ensure even distribution, and form into pills the size of mung beans. Take five to seven pills before meals with warm wine, three times a day. Within five to seven days, one may notice a slight dripping of urine, indicating the efficacy of the medicine. If urine appears like bluish membranes, this shows the root of the illness. Avoid damp or poisonous foods.

    Baoming Lianqiao Decoction:
    One pound each of Lianqiao and Qumai, three taels of rhubarb, and two taels of licorice. Grind these together. Each dose is one tael, with two bowls of water, simmered down to one and a half cups. Take after breakfast and around the hour after. After taking the medicine for more than ten days, one may moxibust the "Lingqi" point for two sets of seven treatments. The medication should not be interrupted; effects are seen after up to sixty days. For an alternative formula, add five taels each of rhubarb, houttuynia, and Fritillaria (or substitute with Zhimu), seven fen of realgar, and half a tael of betel nut; omit licorice. Grind to a fine powder, dissolve in boiled water, and take three to five fen.[85p]

    Bisheng Pill

    For treating lymphadenitis, regardless of how long it has persisted or whether it has just appeared, as well as small lumps on both sides of the back of the head, particularly in conjunction with fatigue and abdominal masses.

    Take one crucian carp, removing the intestines and roe. A piece of realgar the size of a chicken egg. One qian of nandou sand, combine these two ingredients inside the carp's belly. Roast the fish over charcoal until the smoke is exhausted.

    One whole centipede. Half a liang of sweet wormwood. Five gardenias. Two pieces of soapberry; combine these four ingredients and burn to a viable state.

    Five castor beans, dehulled and roasted over a flame. Three wen of yellow gelatin.

    Grind the above into a powder. Separately, take two pieces of soapberry, dehulled and crushed, and mix with three bowls of water, straining out the residue. Boil tender lamb meat (four liang) until soft, adding five li of light powder, and half a liang of male breast milk, all ground into a paste. Form into pills the size of mung beans, coated with cinnabar, and take ten pills in warm wine each morning. In the evening, examine the lump; if five appear on the neck, take five doses of the medicine. Adjust the number of doses according to the quantity formed. If necessary, take additional doses.[86p]

    White Flower Snake Powder: It treats longstanding issues of leprosy that arise in the neck and armpits, characterized by an aversion to cold and fever, with or without pain.

    Use two taels of white flower snake soaked in wine, remove the skin and bones, and dry. Also, mix equal parts of two-taels of rhino horn shavings, green peels, and half a tael each of black morning glory, prepared both raw and stir-fried.

    Grind these into a powder. For each dose, take two qian (a weight measurement), add half a qian of fatty powder, mix well, and take with a drink of glutinous rice water during the fifth watch (around 3-5 AM). This will help clear out harmful substances, addressing the root of the sores. After waiting ten or more days, take another dose. Avoid consuming any warming or obstructive substances. If sores are already formed, results may be seen in a month, with effective results.

    Small Rhino Horn Pill: Regular consumption eliminates the root cause and cuts off its source, with miraculous effects. This formula is suitable for treating various sores.

    Use one tael each of rhino horn, green peel, black morning glory (prepared half raw and half stir-fried), dried tangerine peel (chen pi) one tael, and half a tael of forsythia.

    Grind these into fine powder. Use two pieces of soapberry (zhang) without skin, soaking and pounding the strings to extract juice, about a bowl's worth. Add two jin of fresh peppermint juice, mix and boil into a paste. Form pills from the powdered medicine, each the size of a tung seed. For each dose, take thirty pills with a forsythia decoction after meals, and alternate with peppermint tea.[87p]

    　　立应散　治瘰疬神效，已破未破皆可服。　　川乌尖七个　连翘　赤芍药　当归　甘草炙　川芎　滑石研，各半两　黄芩　白牵牛生，取末　土蜂房蜜水洗，饭上蒸，日干，各二钱半　地胆去头翅足，拌米炒，米黄为度，去米秤三钱。　　右为细末，每服抄一大钱七，浓煎木通汤调下，临卧服。毒根从小便中出，濇病不妨。毒根如粉片块血烂肉是也。如未效，再服，继以薄荷丹解其风热。且地胆性带毒，济以乌尖，或冲上麻闷不能强制，嚼葱白一寸，茶清下以解之。如小便濇，灯心汤调服五苓散。疮处用好膏药贴。若痈疽用此，宣导恶毒，本方去黄芩不用。[88p]

    This formula is effective for treating scrofula, suitable for both those who have begun to heal and those who have not. The mixture includes seven pieces of Chuanwu, Lianqiao, Chi Shaoyao, Danggui, roasted Gan Cao, Chuanxiong, and powdered Talcum, each at half a liang. Additionally, Huangqin and raw Baiqianqiu are ground to a powder, washed with honey water from wild bee nests, steamed with rice, and dried, each at two and a half qian. The top wings and feet of the Ditan (earth gall), mixed with rice and stir-fried until the rice turns yellow, is used to weigh out three qian of rice.

    This fine powder should be taken in doses of 1 large qian and brewed with stronger Mujin decoction before bedtime. The toxic roots will be eliminated through urine; a heavy illness is not a concern. The toxic roots resemble powdered pieces of rotten flesh and blood. If it does not work, take again and follow with peppermint to dispel wind-heat. The Ditan itself is toxic, but when combined with Chuanwu, or if there is a feeling of heaviness and constraint, chew one inch of green onion and drink it with clear tea to relieve it. If urination is difficult, take Wuling Powder mixed with lantern heart decoction. For ulcerated wounds, apply high-quality plaster. If treating carbuncles, this formula promotes the expulsion of toxins; in this case, omit Huangqin.[88p]

    Treatment for Scrofula with Male and Female Dandelions
    One male and one female dandelion, with complete legs and wings, after the new tile is burnt, remove the head, wings, and legs. Grind and mix with two coins of bitter herbs and licorice to create a fine powder. Take in two doses after a full meal, mixing with a cup of strong tea.

    Fairy Unmatched Pill for Scrofula
    Ingredients: White Atractylodes, Betel Nut, Siler, half fried and half raw black bindweed, take the head and grind it; honeyed ball, remove wings and legs from the dandelion. Fry with glutinous rice, remove the rice. Soak in (wood aromatic) apricot kernel soup, remove the skins. Licorice, each five coins. Grind into a fine powder, make pills the size of a wutou (traditional Chinese medicine grain). Take twenty pills each time, twice a day, with a decoction of licorice and betel nut until one month. You may feel slight pain in the abdomen, and expel poisonous substances appearing like fish eyes in urine. Those that have burst will heal naturally, and those that have not will dissipate on their own.

    For treating cold sores, initial swelling and pain, chills, fever, and restlessness in the limbs.

    Zhike Pills
    For treating sores, festering ulcers, swelling, and cold sores.

    Neixiao Pills
    For treating early-stage swelling of wounds and hot toxins accumulated in cold sores and tuberculous nodules. Taking them internally promotes significant effects.
    Ingredients: Qingpi (green tangerine peel), Chenpi (aged tangerine peel), each 2 taels; Qian Niuzi 8 taels, take 2 taels of the head powder; Bohe (mint) 8 taels; Zaojiao 8 taels, select those without worms, remove the rough skin and crush.

    　　必效散　治瘰疬，气血虽无亏损，内有疬核未去而不能愈。　　南硼砂二钱半　轻粉一钱　巴豆五粒，去心膜　白槟榔一个　螌蝥十四枚，去足翅，同糯米炒　麝香五分　　右，同研极细末，取鸡子二个，去黄用清调药，仍入壳内，以湿纸数重糊口，入饭甑候熟，取出晒干研末虚者每服半钱，实者一钱，用煨生姜酒五更初调服。如觉小腹痛，用益元散一服，其毒俱从大便出。胎妇勿饵。毒去后，多服益气养荣汤，疮口自合。《精要》云：治瘰疬用必效散，与栝蒌散相间服，神效。致有不问虚实，概用必效散者，殊不知螌蝥性猛，有大毒，利水破血，大损元气，若实者用此劫之而后，继以补剂或可愈；若虚而用此，或用追蚀之剂，瘀肉虽去而疮口不合，反致不救。[91p]

    To effectively treat scrofula, it is essential to use the prescribed formula. Even if the Qi and blood are not deficient, the internal nodules remain, preventing recovery.

    Ingredients:

    • 2.5 qian of southern borax
    • 1 qian of talcum powder
    • 5 seeds of croton (remove the heart and membrane)
    • 1 areca nut
    • 14 Chinese pill bugs (remove feet and wings, fry with glutinous rice)
    • 0.5 qian of musk

    All these should be ground into a very fine powder. Take two eggs, remove the yolk, and mix with the medicinal powder using clear water, then put it back into the shells. Cover the openings with damp paper multiple times and steam until cooked. Afterward, dry and grind into powder. For those with a deficiency, take 0.5 qian per dose; for those with a surplus, take 1 qian, mixed with ginger wine at the fifth watch (around 4-5 AM). If one feels pain in the lower abdomen, take a dose of Yiyuan powder, and the toxins will be expelled through bowel movements. Pregnant women should not take this.

    After the toxins have been eliminated, it is advisable to consume the Qi-nourishing and vitality-restoring decoction frequently, which will help the sores heal naturally. According to the essential formula, when treating scrofula with the Effective Powder, it should be alternated with the Gua Lou Powder for remarkable efficacy.

    Those who indiscriminately use the Effective Powder without considering whether there is deficiency or surplus should be aware that the pill bug is very potent, has great toxicity, promotes urination, and breaks blood, significantly draining the vital essence. If a person is surplus and uses this to attack it, then supplements may follow to restore health; however, if a person is deficient and this is used, even if the stagnant flesh is removed, the sores may not heal and the situation could worsen.[91p]

    Four Holy Powders: For treating scrofula, take the white flower snake powder to promote benefit, then take this medicine to mix it, ensuring the root is eradicated forever.

    Sea Vegetable Pills: For treating scrofula that appears at the junction of the neck, known as snake coil sores, it is advisable to treat early.     To make the medicine for alleviating suffering, namely the "Rescue from Suffering Pills," for treating flowing ulcer:

    Prepare the following ingredients:

    • Skinless Chuanwu (aconite), 5 taels,
    • Angelica wine soaked overnight,
    • Myrrh,
    • Bai Zhi (angelica dahurica),
    • Aged tangerine peel, each 1 tael,
    • Licorice, 1 tael,
    • Ginger, half tael,
    • Cicada slough, washed with water, half tael,
    • Soap pod, 7 pieces, peeled and strung.

    Crush the soap pod and add 4 large bowls of water, boil down to 2 large bowls. Strain to remove the residue, and use the liquid to cook Chuanwu and other aconite until they become soft enough to mash into a paste. The remaining herbs should be powdered separately and mixed with the aconite paste to form pills the size of a tung seed. Each time, take 60 pills, using peppermint tea regardless of hunger or fullness.

    If the ulcer has already burst, make perforations where the swelling occurs, which may be as large as a finger, either black or white. This is due to the wind and qi clashing, so it is advisable to use a remedy to dispel wind and regulate the flow of qi, particularly the "Transform Qi and Regulate Menstruation Decoction."

    This decoction should be taken in between doses of the "Rescue from Suffering Pills" for treating flowing ulcers. Ingredients include:

    • Xiangfuzi (cyperus) soaked in wine overnight and then dried under the sun,
    • Qianghuo and Bai Zhi, each 1 tael,
    • Fire-calcined oyster,
    • Licorice,
    • Tiannohua fen (unicorn plant powder) and soap thorn, each half tael,
    • Tangerine peel, 2 taels.

    Grind these into a fine powder, and take 2 qian at a time using warm water, not limited by time, three times daily. If the pulse is strong, first take the "Chase Toxic Deity Decoction," followed by the "Rescue from Suffering Pills."[99p]

    Golden Balm
    Removes decayed and rotten flesh without harming good or fresh meat.
    Take five bowls of mulberry wood ash, pour on ten bowls of boiling broth to moisten it. First, place one layer of straw paper, two layers of leather paper at the bottom of a basket, then put the ash on top. Add two taels of pangolin, and stew one qian of arsenic. Take seven almond kernels, remove the skin and tips, then grind them finely with the arsenic and pangolin. Take two taels of raw rehmannia, extract the juice. One qian of realgar powder, grind it fine. Take half a qian of musk and grind it.
    Now filter the ash juice until clear, boil it down, then add the powdered pangolin and the rehmannia juice. Wait until half dry, then add the musk, followed by the realgar powder and the previous ingredients. Wait until it becomes a balm, then add one tael of quicklime powder to form blocks, store them tightly without exposure to air. Use it on the lesions as needed.

    Dragon Pearl Balm
    Treats early-stage symptoms.
    Five liang of dragon’s tooth herb, half a liang of jujube root, two and a half qian of seaweed, half a liang of sappan wood.
    Finely chop the above, measure twenty bowls of water, boil down to twelve or thirteen bowls, then filter out the dregs. Also take two and a half bowls each of mulberry wood ash, lime, and cocklebur ash. Using two layers of straw paper and two layers of leather paper, place at the bottom of a basket, then add the ash on top. Use the hot decoction to moisten it, taking about ten bowls of ash juice, clarify it, and boil down to a balm form. Store it in a ceramic jar with castor bean powder, white clove, gypsum, musk, and talcum powder; apply on the lesions. When reapplying, remove the old medicine and scabs, and then apply the new medicine, and the lesions will rupture and heal. For smaller roots, just apply the medicine to the roots, which will naturally rupture.[101p]

    Snail Powder [from "San Yin Fang"]
    Used to treat scrofula, both when it has burst and when it hasn’t.

    Bat Powder: Treats lesions that have not healed for many years.
    One bat and one owl head are burned together to ash, then mixed with roasted black beans. The resulting fine ash should be moistened when using it, and dry oil can be used for application. Internally, take Five Spice and Forsythia decoction.

    Snail Ash Powder: Burn field snails with shells to preserve their properties.
    Grind into a fine powder; for those that are broken, mix with fragrant oil for application.

    Another formula for treating unbroken lymphatic swellings that do not respond to various medications, works like magic:
    Dry apricot tree leaves into powder (5 parts), burnt human fat into powder (5 parts), fire-dried bat into powder (5 parts), and burnt ash of white flower snake shed (2.5 parts each); seven roasted honeybees into powder.
    Mix the apricot leaf powder with clean water, then add the other four powdered ingredients, stir well, and apply to the affected area. Use a piece of paper with needle holes punctured to cover the medicine, and if it dries, brush clean water on the paper. Change the dressing every 24 hours. If there is a feeling of heat on the face, drink a cooling remedy. After several applications, the heat will subside.

    Another formula that can resolve lymphatic swellings, with miraculous effects:
    Use white resin, cuttlefish bone, and high-quality incense without soil. Grind them into equal parts and apply to the affected area, covering with wet paper. Results should be seen by the next evening.

    Another formula for treating already broken lesions.[103p]

    Twenty-one bees, seven and a half snake sloughs, and two centipedes, collected before the Dragon Boat Festival. Use four taels of fragrant oil, combine the three medicines into the oil, and simmer on both gentle and strong fires until it becomes a paste. Add two taels of light powder and seven mulberry branches the size of chopsticks. Stir quickly, let it cool, and remove the heat for seven days and nights, then it can be spread with paper as a paste to apply to the affected area.

    Shengsheng Huanjui Powder by Guo's family is for treating scrofula and stubborn sores, meant to erode dead flesh with harsh medicines; do not use for urgent cases. Two qian of white silkworms, one and a half qian of white alum, wingless and legless conch, raw realgar, Aconitum, and indigo, each one qian; a little musk. Grind these into a very fine powder, sprinkle a little into the wound, protect the rotten flesh with a medicinal plaster to dissolve the pus.

    Shengji Ganpou Powder treats scrofula and horse knife sores, for those with non-drying pus. Huanglian, Fritillaria, incense and myrrh, each three and a half qian; two taels of white alum, one tael and three qian of white stone, five qian of realgar, and five qian of mullen, fine powder. Prepare this as a powder, wash with medicinal water, then apply the powder externally with a plaster.

    Three kinds of pills:
    Superior grade: treats all types of hemorrhoids. Two taels of white alum, one tael and five qian of white stone, three and a half qian each of frankincense and myrrh, three qian of yellow realgar.
    Middle grade: treats five leaks and six lumps, gas nuclei, scrofula. Two taels of white alum, one tael and three qian of white stone, three qian each of frankincense and myrrh, two qian of yellow realgar.
    Lower grade: treats scrofula gas nuclei and severe sores with six lumps.[104p]

    　　紫霞锭子　治瘰疬、痔漏、恶疮。

    Two taels of alum, one and a half taels of verdigris, two and a half qian each of frankincense and myrrh, one qian of realgar. The three ingredients above follow the same preparation method. First, crush the verdigris to the size of beans, place it in a dry pan, cover it with alum powder, then cover with a tile and char with charcoal until the smoke is gone. Remove and let cool to powder. Use glutinous rice paste to make a thread and dry it in the shade. Depending on the size and depth of the wound, cut it accordingly. First, use an iron tube to break the detoxifying ointment, then insert the medicine thread into the wound and apply the ointment. When the medicine thread has dissolved, it needs to be replaced three to four times, and for deeper wounds, five to six times, until it decays and ulcerates. For wounds exposed to the outside, also use honey water to apply, and it can be dried if wet.

    The purple mist pill treats scrofula, hemorrhoids, and ulcers.

    For the pill: one qian each of calcined verdigris, calcined alum, and arsenic; five fen each of blue vitriol, realgar, and vermilion; two and a half fen each of frankincense and myrrh; half a fen of musk and powdered ammonium. The powder is molded into a pill the size of beans, slightly flattened, and also made into medicine thread. Depending on the size and depth of the wound, cut accordingly. First, apply the detoxifying ointment to break the skin, then place the pill on the wound, cover with ointment, and change the medicine every three days. When the flesh begins to decay, insert the pill into the wound, cover with ointment, and continue until all rotten flesh is removed.[105p]

    Three Talents Red Cloud Pill: for treating scrofula, hemorrhoids, six tumors, and ulcers.

    Heavenly Talent: First, treat the open sores with strict medicine.
    Take five qian of calcined alum, three qian of realgar, two qian each of authentic stone, raw niter, and vermilion, and one and a half qian each of vitriol, frankincense, and myrrh, with a pinch of musk and camphor.

    Earthly Talent: Next, remove dead flesh with moderate medicine.
    Take five qian of calcined alum, three qian of realgar, two qian each of calcined authentic stone and vermilion, and one and a half qian each of raw niter, vitriol, frankincense, and myrrh, with five fen each of catechu and dragon's blood, and a pinch of musk and camphor.

    Human Talent: Then, promote the growth of new flesh and remove stagnant blood with slow medicine.
    Take five qian of calcined alum, three qian of realgar, two qian each of calcinated red resin, catechu, and vermilion; boil down raw niter, calcined vitriol, frankincense, myrrh, and dragon's blood, with one and a half qian of each, and a pinch of musk and camphor.

    For the above powders, use the millet flour to make pills about the size of a bean, flattened, and dried in the shade. Then make medicated threads similar to ephedra. First, apply the iron jar ointment on the sore to darken it; next, apply these pills, and place a medicated patch over it, changing the medicine every three days. If any rotten flesh remains, you can use the lower-grade pills and needle-head powder to remove the decayed flesh completely. For any remaining pus, use a powder to promote flesh growth and dry the pus at the wound; apply a medicated patch over it. If you need to promote the growth of flesh quickly, use the flesh-growing powder directly on the wound and cover it with a medicated patch.[106p]

    Jade tablets cure scrofula and sores.

    Three qian of copper green, calcined vitriol, white clove, calcined arsenic, natural resin, realgar, cinnabar, dripped frankincense, bright myrrh, and light powder, each one qian; a small amount of musk and borax. Grind these into a fine powder and mix with water to form a thick paste shaped like large beans but slightly flattened; then dry both the tablets and the medicinal thread in the shade. First, use a detoxifying ointment to pierce the sore, and then apply the medicated plaster until all necrotic tissue is removed, only keeping the plaster on until healthy flesh regenerates.

    Another formula treats nodules located on the Shaoyang channel behind the neck, regardless of color or size, and whether there is deep pain or swelling that is red and hard. Take a piece of fresh yam and peel it, along with one seed of castor bean. Grind them together evenly, apply it as a poultice, and it will work wonders. Danxi says: Yam nourishes Yang qi, and the fresh form can reduce swelling and hardness. The classics say: Where there is deficiency, evil must gather; if it remains, it becomes substantial. Is this not the description of swelling and hardness? By solidifying their qi, it prevents stagnation from occurring.

    Mountain Tz'u Kou (a type of plant) and ginger are evenly mixed. Both should be pounded into a paste, the juice removed and applied as a poultice, which can disperse cold and heat. Alternatively, it can also be ground with Tz'u Kou, mixed with wine and taken, which is very effective. This medicine is remarkably capable of dispersing nodules almost miraculously.

    Scented Herb Paste treats nodules and swellings, or when wind and cold invade the meridians, causing lumps or pain. The amount of Scented Herb is not specified. It should be ground into a powder, mixed with wine into a paste, and applied to the affected area, heated. For those not fully formed, they will dissolve internally; for those already formed, they will naturally burst. If wind, cold, or damp poison is involved, use ginger juice to make the paste.

    Lychee Paste treats nodules. One liang of lychee flesh, half a qian each of light powder, musk, white cardamom, Sichuan lovage, and sand seed, five whole scorpions, one qian each of cinnabar, dragon bones, blood-stopping resin, and frankincense. Mash the lychee flesh, mixing it with soft rice to make a paste, and apply according to the size of the sore. If there are three to five nodules, it is best to leave only the head.

    Beehive Paste treats heat- and toxin-induced conditions that lead to nodules. Dried beehive, dried snake skin, original ginseng, snake bed seeds, and astragalus are each three fen; one and a half liang of apricot kernels, along with some chicken hair, two liang of lead red, and two liang of wax. First, grind the first five ingredients finely and wrap them in cotton. Use a small amount of wine to soak overnight, avoiding excess wine, then add half a jin of oil. Simmer the apricot kernels and chicken hair until thoroughly boiled, and once they have completely dissolved, filter them. Next, add the lead red and wax, simmering for another five to seven boils, then pour it into a ceramic basin to cool, and apply it to the sores, changing it once a day.[108p]

    　　铁筒拔毒膏　治痈疽疖毒，瘰疬，六疔瘤，疔疮，顽癣，痔漏，痣赘，恶疮肿疡，一切恶核等毒。已成者点破，脓腐即去。未成者，自然消散其毒；虽不能全消，亦得以杀其毒也。
    　　蓄麦秸灰　桑柴灰　矿石灰各三碗　炭灰一盏　　右将四灰和匀，用酒漏一个，将棕帕塞住窍，用水三十碗熬滚，淋灰汁，将汁复熬滚，复淋过，取净药力，慢火入磁罐煎熬，以纸数重固口，熬至一碗为度，乘滚入矿石灰末搅匀，如糊之样，入黄丹，取如微红之色，密封固罐口，候冷。次日将厚实，磁罐收贮，密塞其口，每用少许，涂毒顶之上，即时咬破。不黑，又点，以黑为度。如药干，以唾调涂。如要急用，只将烧大柴灰九碗，石灰三碗"淋灰汁熬浓如前制用。更有枯瘤膏、十陈膏，治法并同。[109p]

    Iron tube poison-extracting balm treats carbuncles, sores, pyogenic infections, scrofula, six types of tumors, abscesses, stubborn ringworm, hemorrhoids, moles, ulcers, swellings, and all types of toxic growths. If they have already formed, pierce them, and the pus and rot will be expelled. If they have not fully formed, the poison will naturally dissipate; even if it cannot fully disappear, it can still kill off the poison.

    Collect three bowls each of wheat straw ash, mulberry wood ash, and mineral lime, and one shao (a small cup) of charcoal ash. Mix these four ashes thoroughly, using a wine strainer and plugging the opening with a cotton cloth. Boil 30 bowls of water and pour in the ash mixture, then boil the liquid again, pour it in once more, to extract the medicinal properties, and simmer it in a clay pot over a slow fire. Seal the pot tightly with paper, and reduce the mixture down until only one bowl remains. While it is still hot, add mineral lime powder and stir it until it reaches a paste-like consistency. Then, add yellow lead until it turns a faint reddish color, sealing the pot tightly and letting it cool. The next day, the thick substance in the clay pot should be stored with the opening sealed tightly. Use a small amount for applying on top of the affected area, immediately piercing through. If it does not blacken, apply again, aiming for a blackened appearance. If the medicine is dry, mix it with saliva for application. If urgent, simply use nine bowls of large firewood ash and three bowls of lime, prepare the ash juice as before and boil it down to a thick consistency. There are also dried tumor ointments and ten-year-old ointments, with similar methods for use.[109p]

    　　黑虎膏　治瘰疬、诸疮神效。
    　　大黄　黄连　黄芩　黄蘗　当归各一两　木鳖子五钱　穿山甲三钱　乱发一丸　蛇蜕一条　清麻油一斤　黄丹水飞，炒，八两　乳香一两　没药五钱　阿魏一钱半　　右将前九味，銼碎，入油浸五七日，煎熬微黑，滤去滓，入黄丹，慢火熬成膏，候冷，入乳香、没药、阿魏末搅匀，油纸摊贴。　　十香膏　治五发恶疮，结核瘰疬，疳痿疽痔。[110p]

    Black Tiger Ointment cures scrofula and various sores with remarkable efficacy.

    Ingredients include:

    • 1 tael each of Dahuang (rhubarb), Huanglian (coptis), Huangqin (baical skullcap), Huangbo (phellodendron), and Danggui (Angelica sinensis);
    • 5 qian of Mubeizi (momordica);
    • 3 qian of Chuan shan jia (pangolin scales);
    • 1 pill of chaotic hair;
    • 1 strip of snake skin;
    • 1 jin of refined sesame oil;
    • 8 taels of powdered yellow lead after roasting;
    • 1 tael of frankincense;
    • 5 qian of myrrh;
    • 1.5 qian of asafetida.

    First, grind the nine ingredients together, soak in oil for five to seven days, then simmer until slightly charred. Strain out the residue, mix in the powdered yellow lead, and slowly cook until it turns into an ointment. Once cooled, mix in the powdered frankincense, myrrh, and asafetida evenly before applying as an oil paper patch.

    Ten Fragrance Ointment treats severe sores, scrofula, tuberculous lymphadenitis, malnutrition, and hemorrhoids.[110p]

    　　沉香　麝香各一钱　安息香　零陵香　木香　丁香　乳香　甘松　白芷　藿香各五钱，为末　当归　商陆根　木鳖子　川芎　黄芪　木通　白芍药　细辛　川升麻　白蔹　独活　川椒　槁本　石菖蒲　厚朴　官桂各二钱　柏子仁　松仁　桃仁　杏仁各五钱　松枝銼　乱发灰　白矾灰　槐枝　桑枝　柳枝　没药　轻粉　雄黄　朱砂　云母犀角各二两，研粉　真酥　羊肾脂　猪脂各二两　黄丹一斤　芝麻油三斤　　右先用木炭火炼油香熟，下一十六味銼碎药，并四枝、四仁，熬至紫黑色，出火，滤去滓，入酥脂煎十余沸，再以新绵滤过油，澄清；拭铛令净，再入火上煎，油沸下丹，用湿柳枝作篦子不住搅，熬一日，滴在水中成珠不散则成也。离火，入十味药末搅匀，再上火，入云母等粉八味，轻煎令沸，出火，不住搅，一食顷，于磁盒内，密封收。每用量疮口大小，绯绢帛上摊贴之。肠胃痈疽，可作丸如梧桐子大，每服七丸，空心温酒送下。[111p]

    Aromatic substances: each of sandalwood and musk, one qian; each of benzoin, liquidambar, agarwood, clove, frankincense, sweet gum, white atractylodes, patchouli, five qian. For the medicinal ingredients: angelica, gallium, bitter cucumber seed, chuanxiong, astragalus, woodbine, white peony, asarum, chuan shengma, white lance, angelica pubescens, sichuan pepper, dried plant roots, acorus, magnolia, and cassia, each two qian. For other ingredients: each of biota seed, pine nut, peach kernel, almond, five qian; sawdust from pine branches, gray from burnt hair, white alum gray, branches of styphnolobium, mulberry, willow, myrrh, light powder, realgar, cinnabar, and mica rhino horn, each two liang. Grind into powder. Each of real clarified butter, sheep kidney fat, and pig fat, two liang; yellow lead one jin; sesame oil three jins.

    First, refine the oil with charcoal fire until fragrant, then add the sixteen crushed medicinal ingredients along with the four branches and four kernels, simmering until a purple-black color is achieved. Remove from heat and filter out the dregs, then boil again with clarified butter for more than a dozen bubbles. Next, filter again through new cotton to clarify; clean the pot, then reheat. With boiling oil, add red lead, and use wet willow branches as a tool to stir constantly, simmering for a day until it drops in water and forms a bead that does not disperse; then it is done.

    Remove from heat and mix in the ten powdered medicinal ingredients. Reheat and add the eight powders including mica, lightly simmer to boil, then remove from heat, stirring constantly for a meal's duration. Store in a sealed ceramic box. Each use, the size of a wound, is applied on silk cloth. For intestinal abscesses, make pills the size of a phoenix seed; take seven pills, empty stomach, with warm wine to consume.[111p]

    　　治瘰疬丸　右先于疮上灸三壮，然后用药溃作疮口，用新活鳝鱼，截长一指大，批开就掩在疮口上。少时，觉疮内痒，急揭起鱼，觑鱼上有细虫如马尾一节，虫出如卷。三五次取尽虫子后，用敛疮口药。　　麝香　粉霜　雄黄　轻粉各半钱　龙脑　乳香各一字　　右为细末，米糊为丸，如小麦大，每用一丸两丸，纴在疮口内，觉肿痛是效。

    Treatment for Scrofula Pills: First, apply three strong moxibustions to the sore, then use the medicine to create an ulcer. Take a live eel, about one finger long, split it open and place it over the ulcer. After a while, you will feel itching inside the sore; urgently remove the fish and observe that there are fine worms resembling a segment of a horse's tail, which will emerge curled. After three to five times of removing the worms, apply the wound-constricting medicine.

    Ingredients:

    • Musk: half a qian
    • Powdered Frost: half a qian
    • Realgar: half a qian
    • Light Powder: half a qian
    • Dragons' Brain: one character
    • Frankincense: one character

    Grind these into a fine powder, form into pills the size of wheat. Use one or two pills at a time, placing them inside the ulcer; if you feel swelling and pain, it is effective.

    Si Wu Decoction treats blood deficiency or heat and all symptoms of blood deficiency. Mix half a money of Angelica and Chuanxiong, one money each of pan-fried Peony and raw Rehmannia. Prepare one dose, using two sheng of water, boil down to eight parts, and take on an empty stomach.

    Angelica Longwei Pills treat scrofula with swelling and pain, or pain beneath the ribs, with the sensation of masses, as well as syphilis-like symptoms, urinary discomfort, constipation, or blood stasis with lower abdominal pain.     　　生地黄丸　许白云学士云：有一师尼患恶风体倦，乍寒乍热，面赤心烦，或时自汗，是时疫气大行，医见寒热，悞作伤寒洽之而大小柴胡汤杂进，数日病剧。予诊视之，曰：三部无寒邪脉，但厥阴肝脉弦长而上鱼际，宜用抑阴之药，遂用此方而愈。更治颈核瘰疬大效。　　生地黄一两，酒拌，捣膏　秦艽　黄芩　柴胡各五钱　赤芍药　　右为细末，入地黄膏加炼蜜少许，丸梧子大，每服三十丸，乌梅煎汤下，日服。

    Sheng Di Huang Wan (Radix Rehmanniae Pill)

    Xu Baiyun, the scholar, said: There was a nun who suffered from a malevolent wind, feeling fatigued, alternating between cold and heat, with a flushed face and a troubled heart, sometimes sweating. At this time, epidemic qi was rampant. The doctor, seeing the cold and heat, mistakenly diagnosed it as a febrile disease and prescribed a mixture of lesser chaihu decoction, but the illness worsened after a few days. Upon examination, I said: There is no cold pathogen in the three pulses, but the jueyin liver pulse is taut and long, extending to the fish region, indicating that cooling medicines should be used. Thus, this prescription was administered, leading to recovery. It also proved very effective for treating neck nodules and scrofula.

    Ingredients: Radix Rehmanniae 1 liang, mixed with wine and ground into a paste. Qin Jiao, Huang Qin, and Chai Hu, each 5 qian. Chi Shao Yao. The above are finely powdered, mixed with Radix Rehmanniae paste and a little refined honey, formed into pills the size of a walnut. Each dose consists of thirty pills, to be taken with a decoction of black plum, daily.

    Xiao Yao San (Free and Easy Powder)

    Used to treat women's blood deficiency, with heat in the five centers, body aches, heaviness in the head and eyes, palpitations, flushed cheeks, dry mouth and throat, fevers with night sweats, reduced appetite, and excessive sleepiness. It also addresses blood heat colliding, with menstrual irregularities, abdominal distension and pain, cold and hot neck nodules, similar to malaria; and it treats young girls with weak blood, unbalanced qi and blood, phlegm coughs with tidal fevers, and emaciation, gradually leading to bone steaming.

    Ingredients: Dang Gui mixed with wine, Shao Yao, Fu Ling, Bai Zhu, Chai Hu, each 1 qian; Gan Cao 3 fen.

    The above constitutes one dose, boil with two sheng of water until reduced to eight parts, to be taken away from meals.[114p]

    Jiaoren Pill
    For diseases of the blood.
    Jiaoren, gan sui, and xu sui zi (with skin removed), ground;
    Fu zi, (mu yu) li ren, he sheng qin, fragmented five spiritual oil;
    Angelica, wu zhu yu, and yan hu suo, each 5 taels;
    Yuanchahua soaked in gall and daikon; gypsum and white arsenic, each 1 tael;
    Ten centipedes, heads and feet removed; glutinous rice fried to yellow, remove the rice;
    Ten phasmids, glutinous rice fried to yellow, remove the rice.
    Grind these into a powder, make into pills the size of peas, take one pill with tangerine peel soup. Although this formula is severe and effective, it is not used in large quantities. If one fears and does not take it, there is a concern for nourishing the disease and harming the body. It is commonly used for weak individuals, and no adverse effects have been observed.[115p]

    Ting Li Wan treats ailments related to water retention.

    Ting li is roasted and ground separately. Mix with the shelled seeds of Xu Sui Zi (Pillow peanut), each weighing half a tael. Add one tael of crushed dried bamboo shoots, then form into pills the size of a wuzi (small seed). Take seven pills, washed down with decocted bamboo soup. If there is significant urination, reduce Xu Sui Zi and Ting Li by one qian each, and add five qian of Bai Zhu.

    Tuo Li Yang Rong Decoction treats scrofula, flowing sores, and all symptoms of insufficiency that do not produce pus, such as not ulcerating, or fever after ulceration, or chills with emaciation, decreased appetite, insomnia, and persistent night sweats.

    Ingredients: one qian each of roasted Ren Shen (ginseng), Huang Qi (astragalus), and Dang Gui (angelica), wine-soaked and mixed; Chuan Xiong (ligusticum), and roasted Shao Yao (peony), each one qian; five fen each of roasted Wu Wei Zi (schisandra) and Mai Men Dong (ophiopogon), with the heart removed; five fen of Gan Cao (licorice); and Shen (cooked) Di Huang (rehu) from fresh sources, mixed with wine and steamed for half a day, avoiding iron utensils.

    Prepare as one dosage: add two sheng of water, three slices of ginger, one jujube, and simmer until two parts remain, then take it away from meals.[116p]

    　　头项强不得顾视：大黑豆蒸熟，纳袋中枕之。 【《本草》，下同】

    Single Prescription

    For stiffness of the head and neck where the person cannot turn their gaze: steam large black beans until cooked, place them in a bag and use it as a pillow.

    For stiffness of the head and neck where the person cannot look back: steam fresh peach leaves and place them in a bag, applying it to the neck.

    For stiffness and urgent pain in the neck: take a live mouse, remove its internal organs, and use the warm body for hot compress; this will cure it. For stiffness caused by wind and dampness, pound castor leaves and apply them as a poultice.

    For stiffness in the neck preventing turning of the head: dig a pit in the ground, heat it until red, sprinkle it with water until it cools, then lay fresh peach leaves on the bed for the patient to lie on, with the neck resting on the leaves, covering with cloth to let the steam rise, causing the patient to sweat profusely; after a while, this will cure it.

    For wind stiffness in the neck: after August, take the spikes of schizonepeta as a pillow, and place them under the bed; remove them after the beginning of spring.

    For children with digestion-related diseases and various ailments causing postural issues, which are due to bodily weakness, it is advisable to use a liniment made from Shengjin powder. Take six wood oil seeds, remove the shells, and sixty castor seeds, remove the shells and grind them together; first bundle it and apply to the head to warm it, then apply with saliva to treat the region.[117p]

    　　小儿项软因风虚者，蛇含石一块，煅七次，酢淬七次，研郁金等分为末，入麝香少许，白米饭丸龙眼大，每服一丸，薄荷汤化服，一日一服。【《活幼全书》】
    　　项下热肿，俗名虾蟆瘟，五叶藤捣敷之。 【《丹溪纂要》】
    　　治对口疮效方：新鲜茄蒂七个，秤若干重，又用鲜何首乌秤同茄蒂重。用水一锺半，煎服。一服出脓，一服收口。如无鲜茄蒂、首乌，干者亦可，但不及鲜者有力。此方轻剂，不可以治重病，观者勿泥也。
    　　凡疬破多年，脓水不绝，用百年茅屋厨中壁土为末，入轻粉调敷，半月即干愈。 【《永类方》】
    　　瘰疬结核：铅二两，铁器炒，取黑灰，酢和涂上，故帛贴之，频换去恶汁，如此半月，不痛不破，内消为水而愈。【《传信方》】
    　　痰核红肿寒热，状如瘰疬：石灰火煅为末，以白果肉同捣贴之，蜜调亦可。 【《活人心镜》】[118p]

    Here is the translated English text:

    For children with weak necks caused by wind deficiency, take a stone that a snake holds, calcine it seven times, soak and quench it seven times, and grind it with safflower to a fine powder. Add a small amount of musk and form pills the size of longan using white rice. Take one pill dissolved in mint tea once a day.

    For heat and swelling under the neck, commonly known as frog plague, apply a poultice of five-leaf vine.

    To treat canker sores: Take seven fresh eggplant stems weighing a certain amount and the same weight of fresh Fleeceflower root. Use one and a half pints of water to decoct and take. One dose will produce pus, and another will close the sore. If fresh ingredients are unavailable, dried ones may also be used, but they are less potent than fresh. This formula is a light remedy and should not be used for severe illnesses; those observing should not be misled.

    For chronic ulcers that have persisted for years without healing, use soil from the walls of a thatched hut aged for a hundred years, ground to a powder, mixed with talcum powder, and applied as a poultice. It will heal by drying in half a month.

    For scrofula (tuberculosis): Use two taels of lead, roast it in an iron vessel to produce black ash, mix with vinegar, and apply it. Cover with silk cloth and frequently change to remove harmful fluids. After half a month, it will not hurt or break, and will heal internally.

    For phlegmatic swelling with heat and cold resembling scrofula: Grind lime to a powder, mix with ginkgo fruit flesh, and apply as a poultice, or mix with honey as an alternative.[118p]

    　　瘘疮有虫：八月中多取螌蝥，以苦酒浸半日，晒干，每用五个，铜器炒熟为末，巴豆一粒，黄犬背上毛二七根，炒研，朱砂五分，同和苦酒顿服，其虫当尽出也。
    　　瘰疬结核：苦参四两，牛膝汁丸菉豆大，每暖水下二十丸。 【《备急方》】
    　　瘰疬溃烂，延至胸前两腋块如茄子大，或牵至两肩上，四五年不能疗者皆治之，其验如神。武进县朱守仁传云：其项不能回头，用此，数日减可。如疮烂破者，用荆芥根下一段剪碎，煎沸汤温洗，良久，看烂破处紫黑，以针一刺去血，再洗三四次，用樟脑、雄黄等分为末，麻油调上出水。次日再洗，再扫，以愈为度。【《活法机要》】
    　　瘰疬结核，或破未破：以新薄荷二斤取汁，皂荚一挺水浸去皮，捣取汁，同于银石器内熬膏，入连翘末半两，连白陈皮一两，连白青皮、黑牵牛半生半炒，皂荚子各一两半，同捣和丸梧子大，每服三十丸，煎连翘汤下。【《济生方》】[119p]

    Fistulas with worms: In the middle of August, often take five locusts, soak them in bitter wine for half a day, and then dry them in the sun. Each time, use five of them, fry them in a copper vessel until they are cooked, then grind them into powder. Add one seed of castor bean and twenty-seven hairs from the back of a yellow dog, fry and grind, and mix in five grams of vermilion, taking it with bitter wine; the worms should all be expelled.

    Lumps and swellings: Take four ounces of bitter sophora, and make pills the size of a mung bean using cow knee juice. Take twenty pills with warm water.

    When the lumps and swellings erupt, extending to the chest and armpits, the size of eggplants, or even pulling to the shoulders, if they cannot be cured after four or five years, they can all be treated with miraculous results. Zhu Shouren from Wu Jin County claims: If the neck cannot turn, use this remedy and within a few days improvement will be felt. If the sore is ulcerated, take a section of the root of schizonepeta, chop it finely, and boil it in hot water to wash the affected area. After a long while, if the ulcerated area appears dark purple, prick it with a needle to let out blood, then wash it three or four times. Use camphor and realgar mixed into powder, adjusted with sesame oil to extract moisture. Wash again the next day and then apply again, using healing as the standard.

    For lumps and swellings, whether they are ruptured or not: Take two pounds of fresh mint to extract juice, soak one stick of soap pod in water to remove its skin, then pound to extract juice. Cook this with half an ounce of forsythia powder in a silver or stone vessel, adding one ounce of white tangerine peel and half an ounce each of the white and black varieties of morning glory, taking one and a half ounces of soap pod seeds; pound and mix into pills the size of walnuts. Take thirty pills with forsythia decoction.[119p]

    　　瘰疬未破：野菊花根捣烂煎，酒服，以滓傅之自消，不消亦自破也。 【《瑞竹堂方》】
    　　瘰疬风病：茵陈蒿两握，水一斗五升，煮取七升，先以皂荚汤洗，次以此汤洗之。冷更作，隔日一洗，不然恐痛也。
    　　风毒瘰疬赤肿：地菘捣敷，干即易之。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　瘰疬已破：葶历二合，豉一升，捣作饼子如钱大，厚二分，安疮孔上，作艾炷灸之，令温热，不可破肉，数易之而灸。但不可灸初起之疮，恐葶苈气入脑伤人也。【《永类钤方》】
    　　瘰疬结核：连翘、芝麻等分为末，时时食之。 【《简便方》】
    　　项边马刀：用连翘二斤，瞿麦一斤，大黄三两，甘草半两，每用一两，以水一碗半，煎七分，食后热服。十余日后，灸临泣穴二七壮，六十日决效。【《活法机要》】
    　　瘰疬未穿：靛花、马齿苋同捣，日日涂敷，取效。 【《简便方》】[120p]

    1. For unbroken scrofula: crush the roots of wild chrysanthemum and decoct in wine, then apply the residue to it to dissolve; if it does not dissolve, it will break on its own.

    2. For scrofula related to wind disease: take two handfuls of artemisia, add 1.5 dou of water, boil to obtain 7 sheng; first wash with soap pod soup, followed by this broth. If it cools again, wash once every other day; otherwise, it may cause pain.

    3. For scrofula with red swelling due to wind toxin: crush and apply the earth mustard, replacing it when dry.

    4. For broken scrofula: take two heaping servings of belamcanda and one sheng of fermented soybean curds, pound into cakes the size of coins, 2 fen thick, place them over the sore holes, and use moxibustion to warm them; do not break the flesh, changing them out while moxibusting. However, do not moxibust newly formed sores, lest the vapors of belamcanda enter the brain and harm the person.

    5. For scrofula tuberculosis: mix and grind for powder equal parts of forsythia and sesame, consume from time to time.

    6. For lateral scrofula: use 2 jin of forsythia, 1 jin of plantago, 3 liang of rhubarb, and 0.5 liang of licorice; use 1 liang each time, with 1.5 bowls of water, decoct to 7 parts, and take after meals warm. After ten days, apply moxibustion at the limin point 27 times; effectiveness will be evident in sixty days.

    7. For unbroken scrofula: crush indigo flowers and purslane together, apply daily for effect.[120p]

    　　瘰疬疔疮发背诸肿：紫花地丁根去粗皮，同白蒺藜为末，油和涂，神效。
    　　瘰疬喉痹攻痛：生商陆根捣作饼，置疬上，以艾炷子灸三四壮，良。 【《外台秘要》】
    　　男妇瘰疬：猫儿眼睛草一二捆，井水二桶，五月五日午时，锅内熬至一桶，去滓澄清，再熬至一碗，瓶收。每以葱椒槐枝煎汤洗，疮净乃搽此膏，数次愈。【《便民图纂方》】
    　　瘰疬结核：蓖麻子炒，去皮，每睡时服二、三枚取效。一生不可吃炒豆。 【《经验方》】
    　　瘰疬恶疮，及软疖，用白胶香一两，瓦器熔化，去滓，以蓖麻子六十四个，去壳研膏，熔胶投之，搅匀，入油半匙，点水中试软硬，添减胶油得所，以绯帛量疮大小摊贴，一膏可治三五疖也。【《儒门事亲》】
    　　瘰疬初作未破，作寒热：草乌头半两，木鳖子二个，以米酢磨之，入捣烂葱头、蚯蚓粪少许，调匀敷上，以纸条贴，令通气孔，妙。【《医林正宗》】[121p]

    Lumps caused by scrofula and carbuncles: The root of purple flower ground ivy should be peeled, mixed to a fine powder with white tribulus, and combined with oil for application; it is remarkably effective.
    Scrofula affecting the throat, causing pain: Fresh roots of merchants' land should be pounded into cakes, placed on the scrofula, and then moxibusted with three or four sticks of mugwort; it is good.
    Both men and women with scrofula: Use one or two bundles of cat-eye grass, two buckets of well water, boil on the fifth of May at noon until you have one bucket, then strain and clarify it; boil down to one bowl and store in a bottle. Each time, use this decoction with scallions, pepper, and locust branches to wash, and after the sores are clean, apply this ointment; several applications will lead to healing.
    Scrofula tubercules: Fry castor beans, remove the skin, and take two or three before sleep for effect. Throughout one's life, avoid eating fried beans.
    Scrofula and abscesses: Use one tael of white resin, melt it in a ceramic vessel, filter out the impurities. Take sixty-four fried castor beans, remove their shells and grind them into a paste; mix in the melted resin, stir well, add half a spoonful of oil, and test its consistency in water, adjusting the amount of resin and oil as needed. Spread a cloth of brocade on the size of the sores; one ointment can treat three to five abscesses.
    Early stage of scrofula not yet ruptured, causing fever and chills: Use half a tael of black aconite, two seeds of the wood-apple, grind them with rice vinegar, mix with crushed scallions and a little earthworm droppings, apply evenly, and cover with a strip of paper to allow air circulation; it is miraculous.[121p]

    　　蝎瘘五孔相通者，半夏末水调涂之，日二。 【《圣惠方》，下同】

    　　瘰疬未破：用月季花头二钱，沉香五钱，芫花炒三钱，銼碎，入大鲫鱼腹中，就以鱼肠封固，洒水各一盏，煮熟食之即愈。鱼须安粪水内游死者方效。此方活人多矣。【试验方】

    　　瘰疬溃烂：冷饭团切片，或为末，水煎服，或入粥内食之，多食妙。忌铁器及发物。 【《积德堂方》】
    　　瘰疬结核：用红娘子十四枚，乳香、砒霜各一钱半，黄丹五分，共为细末，糯米粥和，作饼贴之，不过一月，其核自然脱下矣。【《简易方》】[122p]

    For scrofula with five open channels connected, apply a mixture of pinellia and water, twice daily.

    For early scrofula, when the energy is strong, crush the root of euphorbia and take it in water, a cup's worth, inducing a big purge which will bring balance.

    For scrofulous nodules: grind one tael of mudan grass into powder, mix it with egg white, and apply on cloth, changing it twice daily until effective.

    For nodular energy: grind dried violet into powder, fry it into ointment, and apply three to five times a day to achieve recovery.

    If scrofula has not ruptured: take two qian of rose flowers, five qian of sandalwood, and three qian of euphorbia, fry and crush them. Insert into the belly of a large carp, seal with fish entrails, sprinkle with water, and cook until done. Consumption will lead to recovery. Fish whiskers should be placed in feces-water to die for effectiveness. This remedy has saved many lives.

    For scrofulous nodules, whether broken or unbroken, even those extending to the chest, treat them all: wash the root of polygonum multiflorum and chew it daily, also crush and apply the leaves; repeat until feeling better.

    For ulcerated scrofula: slice cold rice balls or grind them into powder, and boil with water to consume, or mix them into porridge to eat; frequent consumption is beneficial. Avoid iron utensils and food that causes adverse reactions.

    For scrofulous nodules: use fourteen red beans, one and a half qian each of frankincense and arsenic, and five points of orpiment, grind into fine powder, mix with glutinous rice porridge to make cakes and apply; within one month, the nodules will detach naturally.[122p]

    　　内消瘰疬，不拘大人小儿，经验方：用螌蝥一两，去翅足，以粟米一升，同炒米焦，去米不用，入薄荷四两为末，乌鸡子清丸如菉豆大，空心腊茶下三丸，加至五丸，却每日减一丸，减至一丸后，每日又服五丸，又日减一丸，以消为度。[123p]

    For a fistula that does not heal, extract juice from通草 and brew it into wine, and drink it daily.

Take three pills decently; gradually reduce by one pill each day until only one pill remains. After that, take five pills daily and then reduce by one pill each day until healed.[123p]

    • For malignant tumors and swellings: pound small garlic and Wuzhuyu together and apply, it will disperse.

    Ulcers of Scrofula: Five qian of mulberry wood ear, one liang of water red beans, three qian of hundred herb frost, two qian of blue alum, and one fen of powdered brain, to be made into a powder, mixed with chicken egg white for application, and washed with a decoction of plantain, mugwort leaves, and mulberry bark.

    Persistent Pus Fistula: Ground peach blossoms, mixed with pig fat for application, three times a day.

    Sudden Non-painful Scrofula: Take white bark from the peach tree and apply it to the sore, cauterizing for two qi (27 times) for a good effect.

    Scrofula Induced by Wind: Pound green walnut husks into a paste and mix with a small amount of clear lime, making it uniform. First wash with leftover rice water, then apply.

    All Types of Fistula: Use thirty jin of the white bark from the shady side of an oak tree, shaved, and boil it with one stone of water producing a斗 (about 10 liters), removing the dregs. Boil until it becomes syrup-like, then take fourteen pieces each of male and female mouse droppings from a toilet, burn, grind them, and mix in one liter of warm wine until uniform; thin people should take five he (about 250ml), which will help expel worms.

    Another Method: Use five sheng of white oak bark, boil in eight dou (about 80 liters) of water, let it boil out and remove the dregs, then simmer down to a paste. Consume daily with a jujube, and apply on the sore. It is advisable to eat alfalfa and salt rice to assist in healing.

    Scrofula on the Neck: Powdered white silkworm taken with water for five fen, three times daily, will heal within ten days.[125p]

    　　瘘疮：楸枝作煎频洗，取效。 【《肘后方》】
    　　瘰疬瘘疮：秋分前后，早晚令人持袋，摘楸叶纳袋中，取七八升，又换锅煎取二升，乃纳不津器中。用时，取麻油半合，蜡一分，酥一栗子许，同消化。又取杏仁七粒，生姜少许，同研米粉二钱，同入膏中搅匀。先涂疮上，经二日来乃拭却，即以蓖子匀涂楸煎满疮上。仍秤取十五斤，以水一石，净釜中煎取三斗，又换锅煎，以软帛裹之，且日一拭，更上新药，不过五六上，已破者即便生肌，未破者即内消。瘥后，须将慎半年。采药及煎时，忌孝子妇人僧道鸡犬见之。【《箧中方》】[126p]

    Fistulas: Boil the leaves of the catalpa tree and wash frequently; it will be effective.

    For scrofula fistulas: Around the autumn equinox, have someone hold a bag in the morning and evening, collect catalpa leaves into the bag, acquiring seven to eight liters. Then, boil them in a pot to obtain two liters, and place it in a container that does not leak. When using, take half a cup of sesame oil, one part wax, and about the size of a chestnut of lard, and mix them until dissolved. Also, take seven almonds and a small amount of ginger, grind them together with two qian of rice flour, and mix into the ointment until even. First, apply it on the sore for two days, then wipe it off, using the boiled extract to cover the sore completely. Measure out fifteen jin, boil with one stone of water in a clean cauldron to obtain three dou, then change pots and boil again. Wrap it in soft cloth, and wipe it daily, applying new medicine each time, not more than five or six applications. If the sore is already broken, it will grow new skin; if not, it will dissolve internally. After healing, care must be taken for six months. During the gathering of herbs and boiling, avoid letting grieving children, women, monks, and dogs see it.[126p]

    　　年久瘰疬：用不蛀皂角子一百粒，米酢一升，硇砂二钱，同煮干，炒令酥，看疬子多少，如一个服一粒，十个服十粒，细嚼，米汤下，酒浸煮服亦可。虚人不可用硇砂。
    　　瘰疬结核：用桑椹子二斗，黑熟者，以布取汁，石器熬成膏，每白汤调服一匙，日三服。【《保命集》】

    　　鼠瘘瘰疬：用猪膏淹生地黄，煎六七沸，涂之。
