    For longstanding scrofula: Use one hundred non-decomposed soap berries, one liter of rice vinegar, and two qian of realgar. Boil them until dry, then fry until crisp. Depending on the size of the scrofula, take one pill for one scrofula, ten pills for ten scrofulas, chew finely, and take with rice soup; it is also acceptable to soak in wine and take. It should not be used by those who are weak.

    For scrofula tubercle: Use two dou of mulberries, specifically black and mature ones, extract the juice with cloth, and boil with stone utensils until it becomes a paste. Take one spoon mixed with white soup three times a day.

    For both male and female scrofula, based on experience, grind four liang of oyster shell and three liang of adenophora root into powder, mix with flour to form balls the size of walnuts. Take thirty balls each time with wine, three times a day, and continue until the roots are eliminated. Initially, Yu Shiweng said scrofula does not depend on whether it has broken or not; use four liang of oyster shell and one liang of licorice in powder form, taken with a money's worth of wax tea after meals, with effectiveness akin to a miracle.

    For scrofula that has not healed for a long time: Use one locust, remove the wings and feet slightly roasted, and swallow with a bowl of gruel on an empty stomach; water can also be used. For severe cases, no more than seven locusts will suffice.

    For rodent fistula: Liu Juanzi used roasted mountain tortoise shell, roasted weasel bone, roasted licorice, realgar, cinnamon bark, and dried ginger, ground into powder, and take a pinchesworth to drink. Additionally, moxibustion should be applied over the sore, mixing a little honey and inserting it into the sore is beneficial.[127p]

    　　瘰疬已溃：狸头烧灰、频敷之。　 【《千金》，下同】[128p]

    Lumps of scrofula in the early stages: Use one gecko, also known as a守宫, roast and grind it, and take half a unit mixed with wine daily.

    Scrofula in the early stages that has not yet broken: Brew strong tea and mix it with honey to apply, changing frequently; it can be reduced in a few days.

    Scrofula that has persisted and formed a hard core: Use aged rice vinegar mixed with honey for application; this will also help dissolve it.

    For scrofula with a mouse fistula: Grind fresh stone calamus into a paste and apply it upon slight breaking. Use cat's fur and skin burnt to ash, mixed with fragrant oil for application. Internally, take powdered white bletilla, mixed with wine, as needed; also pound white bletilla, add a little wine, and take it as well.

    Cat brain, dried in the shade, is used to treat scrofula mouse fistula ulcers, mixed equally with other herbs into a powder to insert into the hole.

    Cat’s eyes are used to treat scrofula mouse fistula. Burned to ash, take a small spoonful with well-water three times a day.

    Cat's tongue is used to treat scrofula mouse fistula; it should be dried in the sun and ground lightly for application.

    Cat's saliva is used for treating scrofula; after puncturing, apply it.

    For scrofula that is swollen and painful and has not healed for a long time: Use the bones of a raccoon’s paw and mix with roasted yellow grease to create a powder; take a small spoonful on an empty stomach with rice water daily.

    For scrofula that has already broken: Use burned raccoon’s head ash for frequent application.[128p]

    　　蛇瘘不愈：蛇腹蛙烧灰封之。

    All cold sores with necrotic tissue: Use powdered dried fox feces from the first month, one cash worth before eating new spring water, twice daily.

    For abscessed lymph nodes: Apply ash from burnt cowhide boots mixed with oil.

    For any cold sores: Have a person expel roundworms and burn the ash, then wash with licorice decoction and apply it; there is no case that does not heal, but be cautious with tastes.

    For snake sores that do not heal: Seal them with ash from snake belly frog.

    For various sores that do not heal: Use three burnt lizards, thirty fried ground gallbladders, and forty fried grasshoppers, grind into powder, make small honey pills the size of beans, take two pills with white soup for those treatments that are ineffective.

    For mouse sores that are rotten: Use one mouse, with an equal amount of chaotic hair the size of a chicken egg, fry with three-year-old lard until completely rendered, apply half of it and take half with wine; this is the secret method not transmitted by Yao.[129p]

    　　白花蛇散治九漏瘰疬发项腋之间，痒痛，憎寒发热。白花蛇酒浸，取肉二两，焙，生犀角一两二钱五分镑研，黑牵牛五钱半生半炒，青皮五钱，为末，每服二钱，入腻粉五分，五更时糯米饮调下，利下恶毒为度。十日一服，可绝病根，忌发物。【《三因方》】

    Treatment for Leukoplakia and Related Conditions:

    For leukoplakia with itching and pain occurring between the neck and armpits, accompanied by aversion to cold and fever, use white flower snake wine. Take two taels of meat, roast it, and grind one and a quarter taels of fresh rhinoceros horn. Combine with five and a half qian of black morning glory (half raw and half roasted) and five qian of green skin, making into a fine powder. Each dose is two qian, mixed with five-fen of grease powder, and taken with glutinous rice drink at dawn. This will effectively purge the toxic substances. Administer every ten days to eradicate the root of the illness, avoiding hair-raising foods.

    For Toad Fistula: Burn chicken droppings to ash and mix with lard for external application.

    For Rodent Fistula that has burst: Take one chicken egg, steam it with rice for half a day, extract the yolk and cook until it turns black. First, clean the wound to dry it out, then insert the medication into the hole. Typically, this results in healing after three applications.

    For Wind Fistula: Take one bee's nest, roast it to a yellow color and grind into a powder. Each application is one qian, mixed with lard for external use.

    For Tumors Under the Chin: Use a large spider (quantity varies), soaked in good wine, then ground into a paste, strained to remove residue. Take this before sleep for best results.

    For Swellings with Fistulas, Regardless of Presence of Head: Use five large spiders, dried in the sun, removed of legs and finely ground. Mix with grease for topical application, applied twice daily.

    For Rodent Fistula Swellings that have released pus: Use two to seven spiders, burned and ground, then applied externally.[130p]

    　　瘰疬结核：黑牛皮胶熔化摊膏贴之。已溃者，将膏搓作线，长寸许，纴入孔中，频换拭之，取效。【《经验方》】
    　　治瘰疬：用牵藤蛇梦草，并根蒂叶红子四两，夏枯草五钱，头生酒谅意用，入砂罐，煮一炷香取起埋土穴中，退火一宿，其煮药时罐内空悬纹银，以煮不变黑色，则其草无毒，可服，如黑去之，另用草煮则无碍矣。初服药酒一杯，随服常酒数杯，取汗后不时常服一杯，一日以五次为度，不可多服。未形者，由泻而内消；已形者，毒水出于小便，一月全效。【《保生秘要》】
    　　颈项瘰疬已破，汁出不止者：用鸭脂调半夏末，日日敷之。 【《永类方》】
    　　项下瘿气：水涯露出柳根三十斤，水一斛，煮取五升，以糯米三升，如常酿酒，日饮。【《范汪方》】
    　　项下瘿气：秫米三斗，炊熟，取圆叶白杨皮十两，勿令见风，切，水五升，煮取二升，溃曲朮五两，如常酿酒，每旦一盏，日再服。【《崔氏方》】[131p]

    Lymphadenitis Tuberculosis: Melt black cattle hide glue and spread it as a paste. For cases that have already ulcerated, roll the paste into a string about an inch long, insert it into the hole, and change and clean it frequently for effectiveness.

    To treat lymphadenitis: Use six taels of Phaedranassa and its root and leaves, along with five qian of Summer withering grass. The head should use wine as preferred. Place in a sand pot and boil until the fragrance arises, then bury in the ground for a night to withdraw the heat. During the boiling, hang silver thread inside the pot; if it remains unblackened, the herbs are non-toxic and can be ingested. If it darkens, boil other herbs without issue. Initially take a cup of the medicinal wine, followed by several cups of regular wine to induce sweating, and do not exceed five cups a day. For those not yet developed, it will dissipate through a purge; for those already developed, poisonous water will exit through urination, achieving full effect in a month.

    For lymphadenitis in the neck that is oozing continuously: Mix duck fat with powdered Pinellia and apply daily.

    For goiter under the chin: Use thirty pounds of willow roots exposed by the water's edge, and one he of water, boiling down to five sheng, and three sheng of glutinous rice, brewing as usual for daily consumption.

    For goiter under the chin: Use three dou of job's tears, cook thoroughly, then take ten taels of round-leafed white poplar bark, avoiding exposure to the wind, cut it, and use five sheng of water, boiling down to two sheng, and add five taels of prepared Atractylodes, brewing in the usual way, take a cup every morning and twice daily.[131p]

    　　鹿靥，主治气瘿，以酒浸炙干，再浸酒中，含咽汁，味尽更易，十具乃愈。 【《深师方》】
    　　用猪靥七枚，酒曲三钱，入水瓶中，露一夜取出，炙食，二服效。 【《杏林摘要》】

    Deer gland is used to treat goiter. Soak it in wine, roast it to dry, and soak it in wine again. Suck the juice until the taste is gone; ten doses can cure.

Before sleeping, take two qian with cold wine gradually; five doses will show results; in severe cases, one dose can cure. Avoid sour, salty, oily, and heavy foods.

    　　瘰疬溃疮：茶、蜈蚣二味，炙至香熟，捣筛为末，先以甘草汤洗净敷之。 【《枕中方》】
    　　雀瘘有虫：母猪屎烧灰，以腊月猪膏和敷，当有虫出。 【《千金方》】
    　　瘰疬溃烂流串者：用荆芥根下段煎汤洗，良久着疮破，紫黑处以针刺去血，再洗三四次，用韭菜地上蚯蚓一把，五更时收取，炭火上烧红为末，每一匙入乳香、没药、轻粉各五分，穿山甲九片，炙为末，油调敷之如神。此武进朱守仁所传有验方。【《保命集》】
    　　瘰疬结核，不问新久已溃未溃并治之，神效。用嫩明松香一两，葱汤煮化，冷水拔净，火麻仁一两，上好松萝茶叶五钱，共捣如泥，油纸摊为膏贴之，未溃即消，已溃即敛，此秘方也。　　又方：穿山甲土炒，螌蝥、熟艾等分，为末敷之，外以乌桕叶贴上，灸四壮，效。 【《寿域方》】
    　　项下瘰疬：用羊膍胵烧灰，香油调敷。
    　　鼠瘘溃坏：新鼠屎一百粒，收密器中五六十日，杵碎即敷之，效。 【《千金方》】[133p]

    • For lumpy tuberculous sores: Mix tea and centipede, roast until fragrant, then grind into powder. First, cleanse the area with licorice decoction before applying.

    • For lumpy sores that are ulcerated and running: Use a decoction of the lower part of the schizopeplus root to wash the area. Take a handful of earthworms from leek ground, collected early in the morning, roast them until red and grind them into powder.     • For tuberculosis, regardless of whether it is new or old, broken or unbroken, treat it for miraculous effects.     颈项门

    　　　　针灸

    　　《素问》曰：肾热病者，先腰痛胻酸，苦渴数饮，身热，热争则项痛而强，胻寒且酸，足下热，不欲言，其逆则项痛员员淡淡然。戊己甚，壬癸大汗。气逆则戊己死。刺足少阴太阳。　　先项背痛者，先刺之。[134p]

    Translation:

    If the scrofula has broken: burn five qian of sheep dung, five qian of apricot kernels, grind into powder, mix with pig bone marrow for application. [“Hai Shang Fang”]

    If the scrofula is ulcerated: take yellow (fish) and break it open, add twenty seeds of castor bean, secure it in a latrine pit; leave it for three days in winter, one day in spring, and half a day in summer. Take it out, wash clean, mix with yellow clay to thicken, calcine it to retain its nature, grind, and apply with fragrant oil. [“Pu Ji Fang”]

    For scrofula on the neck: take left spiral dragon, stir-fry and grind into powder, mix with rice to form balls the size of wutong seeds; take three to fifty balls at a time, swallowing with rice wine. [“Zhang Zi He Fang”]

    For mouse fistula scrofula, use the Five White Powder: one sheng each of white cow dung, white horse dung, white sheep dung, white chicken dung, and white pig dung, burn to ash. Two liang of filtered reed powder, along with one sheng of pig fat, simmer together until frothy, then apply. This is remarkably effective. [“Qian Jin Fang”]

    Neck Region

    Acupuncture and Moxibustion

    The "Su Wen" states: In cases of kidney heat disease, one first experiences soreness in the waist and thighs, severe thirst requiring frequent drinking, fever in the body, pain in the neck from heat attacking, cold and sore thighs, heat in the feet, reluctance to speak; if the reverse occurs, the neck pains gently and lightly. If there is severe distress, there is great sweating associated with the ren and gui elements. Reversal of qi leads to dead ren and gui. Puncture the foot's shaoyin and taiyang. For those experiencing pain in the neck and back first, treat that area first.[134p]

    　　大风颈项痛，刺风府，风府在上椎。　　《灵枢》曰：大肠手阳明之脉，其支者，从缺盆上颈贯颊，入下齿中，还出挟口，交人中，左之右，右之左，上挟鼻孔。是动则病齿痛颈肿，视盛虚热寒取之也。　　胃足阳明之脉，是主血所生病者，狂疟温淫，汗出，鼽衄，口喎唇胗，颈肿喉痹，视盛虚热寒取之也。　　小肠手太阳之脉，其支者，从缺盆循颈上颊，至目锐眦，却入耳中；其支者，别颊上(出页)抵鼻，至目内眦，斜络于颧。是动则病咽痛颔肿不可以顾，肩似拔，臑似折。是主液所生病者，耳聋目黄，颊肿，颈颔肩臑肘臂外后廉痛，视盛衰热寒取之也。　　膀胱足太阳之脉，是动则病冲头痛，目似脱，项如拔，脊痛，腰似折，髀不可以曲，腘如结，腨如裂，是为踝厥。[135p]

    Severe neck pain from strong wind, piercing Wind Mansion, which is located at the upper vertebrae. "Lingshu" states: the hand Yangming meridian of the large intestine has a branch that runs from the hollow of the collarbone up the neck, crossing the cheek, entering the lower teeth, then exiting beside the mouth, intersecting at the Philtrum, each side mirroring the other, up to the nostrils. If activated, it causes tooth pain and swollen neck, influenced by excess or deficiency, heat or cold.

    The foot Yangming meridian of the stomach governs diseases arising from blood, including mania, intermittent fever, excessive sweating, nasal bleeding, speech slurring, swollen neck, and throat blockage, influenced by excess or deficiency, heat or cold.

    The hand Taiyang meridian of the small intestine has a branch that follows from the hollow of the collarbone along the neck up to the cheek, reaching the inner corner of the eye, and then enters the ear; another branch departs from the cheek, reaches the nose, and crosses the inner corner of the eye, intertwining at the cheekbone. If activated, it causes throat pain and swelling of the jaw, making it difficult to look around; shoulder feels like being pulled, upper arm feels like being broken. This meridian governs diseases generated from fluids, leading to deafness, jaundice, cheek swelling, and pain in the neck, jaw, shoulder, upper arm, elbow, and outer back, influenced by excess or deficiency, heat or cold.

    The foot Taiyang meridian of the bladder, if activated, causes throbbing headaches, perception of the eyes feeling displaced, stiff neck, back pain, a feeling of the waist being broken, inability to bend at the thigh, tightness in the knee, and a sensation akin to splitting in the ankle, leading to ankle cramps.[135p]

    视盛虚热寒取之也。　　手阳明之筋，其支者绕肩胛挟脊，直者从肩上髃上颈。其病当所过者支痛及转筋，肩不举，颈不可左右视，治在燔针劫刺，以知为数，以痛为腧，名为孟夏痹也。　　手太阳之筋，起于小指之上，入结于腋下；其支者，后走腋后廉，上绕肩胛，循颈，出足太阳之前，结于耳后完骨。其病腋后廉痛，绕肩胛引颈而痛，应耳中鸣痛引颔，目瞑良久乃得视，颈筋急则为筋痿颈肿，寒热在颈者，治在燔针劫刺，以知为数，以痛为腧，其为肿者复而锐之。　　手少阳之筋，起于小指次指之端，结于腕上，循臂结于肘上，绕臑外廉，上肩走颈，合手太阳。其病当所过者，即支转筋舌卷，治在燔针劫刺，以知为数，以痛为腧，名为季夏痹也。　　邪在肾则病骨痛阳痹。[136p]

    The view of excess and deficiency is determined by heat and cold. The muscle of the hand of the Yangming (Large Intestine) begins at the thumb's upper side, with its branches encircling the shoulder blade and close to the spine, while the direct part follows from the shoulder to the base of the neck. When illness affects the area it traverses, symptoms include pain and cramps, inability to raise the shoulder, and stiffness in the neck preventing lateral movement. Treatment involves burning needles and pricking; diagnosis is based on the numbers and pain points, and it is called "Summer onset paralysis."

    The muscle of the hand of the Taiyang (Small Intestine) originates from above the little finger and connects at the armpit; its branches extend to the back of the armpit, envelop around the shoulder blade, follow the neck, and exit in front of the foot of the Taiyang, connecting at the back of the ear's bony prominence. Symptoms include pain in the area behind the armpit, shoulder blade pain radiating to the neck, associated with ringing and pain in the ear, with prolonged closure of the eyes leading to recovery of vision. If the neck muscles are tense, it can lead to muscular atrophy and swelling in the neck due to heat or cold. Treatment involves burning needles and pricking; diagnosis is based on the numbers and pain points, and swelling requires additional sharp treatment.

    The muscle of the hand of the Shaoyang (Triple Heater) starts at the tip of the little and next fingers and connects at the wrist, moving up the arm to the elbow, encircling the outer aspect of the arm, proceeding to the shoulder, and joining the hand of the Taiyang. Symptoms in the areas it traverses include cramping and rolled tongue. Treatment involves burning needles and pricking; diagnosis is based on the numbers and pain points, and it is called "Late Summer paralysis."

    If the pathogenic factor is in the kidneys, it causes bone pain and Yang paralysis.[136p]

    阳痹者，按之而不得，腹胀腰痛，大便难，肩背颈项痛。时眩，取之涌泉、昆仑，视有血者尽取之。　　厥头痛，项先痛，腰即为应，先取天柱，后取足太阳。　　项痛不可俯仰，刺足太阳；不可以顾，刺手太阳也。　　黄帝曰：鼠瘘寒热之毒气，去之奈何？岐伯曰：鼠瘘之本，皆在于脏，其末上出于颈腋之间，其浮于脉中而未内着于肌肉，而外为脓血者，易去也。黄帝曰：去之奈何？岐伯曰：请从其本，引其末，可使衰去而绝其寒热，审按其道以予之，徐往徐来以去之。其小如麦者，一刺知，三刺而已。　　《甲乙经》曰：头项痛重，暂起僵仆，鼻窒鼽衄，喘息不得通，通天主之。　　项上痛，风头重，目如脱，不可左右顾，百会主之。[137p]

    Yang bi (yang paralysis) is characterized by pressure that yields no results, abdominal swelling, lower back pain, difficulty in defecation, and pain in the shoulders, back, and neck. Sometimes accompanied by dizziness, treat with points Yongquan and Kunlun, and completely draw out any blood present.

    For intense headaches, start with pain in the neck which then affects the lower back; begin with point Tianzhu, and then use point Zuyin. If neck pain prevents looking up or down, needle the point Zuyin; if it hinders looking sideways, needle the point Shouyin.

    The Yellow Emperor asked: How can we remove the poison of the cold and heat from the shrew's fistula? Qibo replied: The root of the shrew's fistula lies in the internal organs, while the ends surface between the neck and armpit, floating in the pulse without penetrating the muscles; when it manifests externally as pus or blood, it can be easily removed. The Yellow Emperor asked: How can it be removed? Qibo answered: We should address the root by pulling out the ends, causing the cold and heat to subside. We must carefully follow the meridian pathways and apply treatment gradually; for small occurrences as tiny as wheat grains, one needled point is enough, and three needleings is sufficient.

    The Classic of the Root and Branch states: For heavy pain in the head and neck, sudden stiffness, nasal obstruction, and difficulty breathing, treat at point Tongtian. For pain at the nape with wind heaviness, and inability to turn the eyes left or right, treat at point Baihui.[137p]

    　　颈痛，项不得顾，目泣出眵目　蔑，鼻鼽衄，目内眦赤痛，气厥，耳目不明，咽喉偻引项，筋挛不收，风池主之。　　项肿不可俯仰，颊肿引耳，完骨主之。　　颈项痛不可以俯仰，头痛振寒，瘈瘲，气实则胁满，侠脊有并气，热汗不出，腰背痛，大杼主之。　　颈项通强，取通天、百会、风池、完骨、痖门、大杼。　　胸中满，腋下肿，马刀瘘，善自嚙舌颊，天牖中肿，消泺胫酸，头眩，枕骨颔腮痛，目濇身痹，洒淅振寒，季胁支满，寒热，胁腰腹膝外(月廉)痛，临泣主之。　　马刀肿瘘，渊液、章门、支沟主之。　　出于颏下，或至颊车者，当于手足阳明经取之，或针或灸，如后穴：三里足阳明，合谷手阳明。　　瘿，天窻及臑会主之，气舍亦主之。　　《千金方》曰：少泽、前谷、后溪、阳谷、完骨、昆仑、小海、攒竹，主项强急痛，不可以顾。[138p]

    Pain in the neck that prevents turning, tears streaming from the eyes, nasal obstruction and bleeding, red painful inner corners of the eyes, shortness of breath, unclear vision and hearing, sore throat pulling at the neck, muscles cramping and not relaxing, is governed by Fengchi (Wind Pool).

    If the neck is swollen making it impossible to look up or down, and the cheeks are swollen pulling at the ears, it is governed by Wanggu (Complete Bone).

    Neck pain that does not allow for looking up or down, headache with chills, tremors, fullness if the Qi is excess, pressure along the spine with accompanying Qi, hot sweat not being released, pain in the lower back, is governed by Dazhu (Great Shuttle).

    If the neck is stiff and tense, one should treat points Tongtian (Heavenly Connection), Baihui (Hundred Meetings), Fengchi, Wanggu, Yamen (Mute Gate), and Dazhu.

    If there is fullness in the chest and swelling under the armpits, difficulties in swallowing, good at chewing the tongue and cheeks, swelling in Tianyou (Sky Window), pain in the shins, dizziness, pain in the occipital bone, jaw, and cheeks, eyes tearful, body numbness, chills with perspiration, fullness in the sides, chills and fever, and pain in the sides, waist, abdomen, and outer knees, it is governed by Linqi (Tearful Encounter).

    Swollen and infected areas from the sword injury should be treated at the points Yuanyue (Deep Fluid), Zhangmen (Chapter Gate), and Zhigou (Branch Ditch).

    If there is an issue originating under the chin, or reaching the jaw, one should treat it along the Yangming channels of the hands and feet, using needling or moxibustion at points such as Sanli (Three Li) on the foot Yangming and Hegu (Joining Valley) on the hand Yangming.

    For goiter, Tianfu (Sky Window) and Crux are the main points of treatment; the chest Qi is also to be addressed.

    The "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" states: Shaoze (Lesser Marsh), Qiangu (Front Valley), Houxi (Back Stream), Yanggu (Sunlight Valley), Wanggu, Kunlun (Kun Lun), Xiaohai (Little Sea), Zanzhu (Gathered Bamboo) are pivotal for addressing strong and urgent pain in the neck, which prevents turning.[138p]

    消泺、本神、通天、强间、风府、喑门[喑门　原作「喑关」，据《千金》卷三十改。]、天柱、风池、龈交、天冲、陶道、外丘、通谷、玉枕，主项如拔，不可左右顾。天容、前谷、角孙、腕骨、支正，主颈肿项痛不可以顾。天容，主颈项痈不能言。角孙，主颈颔柱满。飞扬、涌泉、颔厌、后顶，主颈项疼，历节汗出。天府、臑会、气舍，主瘿瘤气，咽肿。脑户、通天、消泺、天突，主颈有大气。通天主瘿，灸五十壮；胸堂、羊屎，灸一百壮。绝骨，主瘘马刀掖肿。大迎、五里、臂臑，主寒热颈瘰疬。天突、天窻，主漏颈痛。侠溪、阳辅、太冲，主掖下肿，马刀瘘。　　《疮疡全书》曰：男子妇人小儿患瘰疬者，依法四六烧灸无不效。肩骨尾尽处是肩井二穴，左肩灸左，右肩灸右，左右俱有俱灸。[139p]

    Xiao Luo, Ben Shen, Tong Tian, Qiang Jian, Feng Fu, Yin Men, Tian Zhu, Feng Chi, Yin Jiao, Tian Chong, Tao Dao, Wai Qiu, Tong Gu, Yu Zhen, are used to treat issues like pulling at the neck, not allowing for left or right turns. Tian Rong, Qian Gu, Jiao Sun, Wan Gu, Zhi Zheng are for treating swelling and pain in the neck, unable to turn. Tian Rong treats neck and throat abscesses that make speech difficult. Jiao Sun treats fullness in the neck and jaw area. Fei Yang, Yong Quan, Han Yan, and Hou Ding are for neck pain and sweating through the joints. Tian Fu, Nao Hui, Qi She are for goiter and throat swelling. Nao Hu, Tong Tian, Xiao Luo, Tian Tu treat significant neck discomfort. Tong Tian addresses goiter, with fifty cautions; Xiong Tang and Yang Shi, with one hundred cautions. Jue Gu treats swelling at the site of knife wounds. Da Ying, Wu Li, Bi Nao are for cold and hot neck lumps. Tian Tu and Tian Kuan treat leaking neck pain. Xia Xi, Yang Fu, Tai Chong are for swelling under the armpits and knife wound leaks.

    The "Complete Book of Ulcers" states: For men, women, and children suffering from lumps, applying the rules of four and six incinerations will prove effective. The area at the end of the shoulder blade is the location for the two shoulder well points; cauterize the left shoulder on the left and the right shoulder on the right, and if both are present, cauterize both.[139p]

    鼠尾一穴，用草一茎，男比左手、女比右手中节横纹，攒量过四指纹尽处，比交折断，将至丝螺骨尖中，比至脚后总筋中，是鼠尾穴，左灸左，右灸右，俱有俱灸，一年五壮，年深多灸。专治一切瘰疬，须要禁忌房事。神效不虚，可以活人。灸毕疮烂，车前草叶捣烂贴之，看遍身人神所在禁忌，并择天医黄道吉日。　　灸忌：既灸，忌诸鱼、热面、生酒、生冷物、鲜肉及房劳。　　又灸两手掌后四寸两筋间各七壮，以病人中指横纹量至本指尖为四寸。再灸肘尖，左病灸右，右病灸左，各三壮。不过三次除根。　　治瘰疬已成未成，己溃未溃，以手置肩上，微举起则肘骨尖自现，是灸处。如患左灸左肘，患右灸右肘，左右俱患两肘皆灸，以三四十壮为期。更服补剂，一年者日灸一次，三灸其疮自除。[140p]

    The mouse tail point is located at one hole, using a single stalk of grass. For men, it corresponds to the horizontal line on the middle segment of the left hand, and for women, it corresponds to the right hand. Measure beyond the four finger widths to the end, and compare it to where it bends and breaks near the tip of the spiral bone, relating to the tendons at the back of the foot; this is the mouse tail point. If you perform moxibustion on the left side, do so on the left side, and on the right side, do so on the right side; both should be treated at the same time, five treatments a year, and more moxibustion as the year progresses. It specifically treats all types of scrofula and requires abstention from sexual activity. The effectiveness is truly miraculous and can save lives. After moxibustion, if there are sores, crush plantain leaves and apply them. Be aware of any prohibitions for the person and choose auspicious days based on celestial healers.

    Prohibitions after moxibustion: after performing moxibustion, avoid all fish, hot foods, raw wine, cold items, fresh meat, and excessive labor.

    Additionally, perform moxibustion on the area between the two tendons on the back of each hand, seven treatments each, measuring from the horizontal line of the middle finger to the tip of the respective finger for four inches. Then perform moxibustion at the elbow tip; if the left is affected, treat the right elbow, and if the right is affected, treat the left elbow, each with three treatments, but no more than three times for complete elimination.

    For treating scrofula, whether it has formed or not, whether it has burst or not, place your hand on the shoulder and raise it slightly so that the elbow bone tip appears; this indicates the site for moxibustion. If the left is affected, moxibustion should be done on the left elbow, if the right is affected then the right elbow should be treated; both elbows should be treated with three or four treatments. Additionally, take supplements; for those who have been treated for a year, moxibustion should be done once daily, and after three treatments, the sores will heal on their own.[140p]

    如患三四年不愈者，辰时灸起，至酉时方止，三灸即愈。更服益气养荣汤。　　又法：未成脓者，用大蒜切片如二钱厚者，安患上，用艾炷于蒜上灸之，至三五壮，换蒜，每日灸十数蒜片，以拔郁毒。如破久不合，内有核或瘀肉，此因气血不足，不能腐烂，更用江西豆豉为末，唾津和为饼，如前灸之，以助阳气。内服补药，外贴金丝膏，疮口自合。　　《东垣十书》曰：腋下肿，马刀挟瘿，善自嚙舌颊，天牖中肿，寒热，取临泣、丘墟各一分，灸五壮；太冲一分，灸三壮。　　腋下颈项肿，取天池顺皮三分，灸七壮；如颔肿，加后溪二分，灸五壮。　　腋下肿，马刀挟瘿，喉痹，取阳辅五分，灸二七壮；申脉一分，灸三壮，立愈。　　诸瘿恶气，灸肩髃，男左十八壮、右十七壮，女右十八壮、左十七壮。在肩端凸骨间陷宛宛中，举臂取之。[141p]

    If afflicted for three to four years without improvement, burn moxa from the hour of Chen until the hour of You, stopping only after three sessions, which will lead to healing. Additionally, take a nourishing tonic.

    Another method: for those not yet forming pus, use garlic sliced to about two coins thick, place it on the affected area, and burn moxa on top of the garlic. After three to five applications, replace the garlic, and perform this daily on ten or more garlic slices to draw out toxic stagnation. If it has broken and not healed, and there are nodules or bruised flesh inside, this is due to insufficient qi and blood preventing decay. Use Jiangxi fermented black soybeans as powder, mix it with saliva to form a paste, and apply moxibustion as before to support yang energy. Internally take tonics and externally apply a golden silken ointment, allowing the wound to heal on its own.

    The "Ten Treatises of Dongyuan" states: if there is swelling under the armpit, with a knife-like swelling, and the patient can bite their tongue and cheek, with swelling in the Tian You area, and alternating cold and heat, take one part each of Lin Qi and Qiu Xu and perform five moxa applications; for Tai Chong, take one part and perform three applications.

    For swelling under the armpit and neck, take three parts of Tian Chi and moxibust for seven applications; if there is swelling in the jaw, add two parts of Hou Xi and moxibust for five applications.

    For swelling under the armpit combined with a knife-like swelling and throat obstruction, take five parts of Yang Fu and moxibust for fourteen applications; for Shen Mai, take one part and moxibust for three applications, leading to immediate healing.

    For all types of goitre causing foul qi, moxibust the shoulder's Yu point, with males receiving eighteen applications on the left and seventeen on the right, while females receive eighteen on the right and seventeen on the left. Locate the moxibustion point between the protuberance of the shoulder bone and its depressions, lifting the arm to find it.[141p]

    　　又法：灸天府七七壮，冲阳随年壮。　　《丹溪心法》曰：灸瘰疬法，捣商陆根作饼子，置于瘰疬上，艾炷灸饼子上，干即易之，灸三四饼。　　《得效方》曰：治瘰疬，以手仰置肩上，微举手取之，肘骨尖上是穴，随患处灸七壮或二七壮，神效。　　《医学纲目》曰：刺灸颈项疮痛有二：其一取手足太阳，治项后痛。经云：足太阳之脉，是动则病项如拔，视虚盛寒热取之。又云：项痛不可俯仰刺足太阳，不可以顾刺手太阳。又云：大风颈项痛，刺风府，风府在上椎。又云：邪客于足太阳之络，令人头项肩痛，刺足小指爪甲上与肉交者，各一痏，立已。不已则刺外踝下三痏，左取右，右取左，如食顷是也。　　其二，取足手阳明，治颈前痛。经云：足阳明之脉，所生病者颈肿。又云：手阳明之脉，是动则病颈肿，皆视盛虚寒热陷下取之也。[142p]

    Another method: Moxibustion at the Tianfu point seven times, and on the Chongyang point as needed each year. "Danxi Xinfa" states: For moxibustion of scrofula, pound the root of the Shanglu plant into a cake, place it on the scrofula, then moxibust the cake with moxa until dried, replacing it as needed, and moxibust three to four cakes. "Dexiao Fang" states: For treating scrofula, place your hand above the shoulder, slightly raise the hand to access it; the acupoint is the tip of the elbow bone. Moxibust seven times or two sets of seven times as needed on the affected area for immediate effect. "Yixue Gangmu" states: There are two approaches for needling and moxibustion for neck pain. The first involves the hand and foot Taiyang channels, treating pain at the back of the neck. The text states that the Taiyang pathway can cause neck pain as if being pulled when in motion; assess for excess or deficiency, cold or heat. It further states that for neck pain, do not needle the foot Taiyang when bending forward or looking up, nor the hand Taiyang when turning around. It also indicates that for wind-related neck pain, needle Fengfu, located on the upper vertebra. It adds that if pathogenic factors affect the foot Taiyang network, it can cause pain in the head, neck, and shoulders; needle the area at the junction of the smallest toe's nail and flesh. If pain persists, needle three points below the outer ankle, alternating sides as if to eat. The second approach involves the foot and hand Yangming channels, treating pain at the front of the neck. The text states that the foot Yangming pathway relates to neck swelling, while the hand Yangming can cause neck swelling with movement; both require assessment of excess or deficiency, cold or heat conditions.[142p]

    　　　　导引

    　　《石室秘箓》曰：颈项强直，乃风也，以一人抱住下身，以一人手拳而摇之，至数千下放手，深按其风门之穴，久之，则其中酸痛乃止。病人乃自坐起，口中微微咽津送下丹田者，七次而后已，一日即痊。　　《保生秘要》曰：瘰疬导引法，用手于肩井穴，掐六十四度，擦之亦如数而行，运法极效。　　运法起于归元，渐引至患处，着意多旋，小而大，彻而散，散而运，运而至于胸间，绕十数回，又旋至疬处，如前法，周而复始，约数十回以散其结。每日送毒一次，从胃口曲入大肠，如法送出谷道外，去浊提清。归元慎走元阳，切戒恼怒发物。其前运法，一昼夜每行七度，自然消散无踪。　　又法：于患处想一筋，右边用左手，左边用右手，扯下肚里去，觉疬疼，又扯下从脚底去。[143p]

    Guidance

    The "Secret Scriptures of the Stone Chamber" says: If the neck and shoulders are stiff, it is due to wind. One person should hold the lower body while another shakes it with a fist until it has been done several thousand times. Then, press deeply on the acupoint known as the wind gate; after a while, the soreness and pain will cease. The patient will then sit up and swallow saliva gently towards the lower dantian seven times before stopping, and recovery will occur within a day.

    The "Essential Secrets of Preserving Life" states: For the treatment of scrofula through guidance, use the hand on the shoulder well (Jing) acupoint, squeezing at sixty-four degrees. Rubbing should also be performed in a similar fashion; the technique is extremely effective. The practice starts at returning to the source, gradually leading to the affected area. Focus is placed on applying rotation, from small to large, penetrating and dispersing, dispersing and guiding, leading to the chest, circling several times, and then rotating back to the affected area. This method is practiced repeatedly, around several dozen times to disperse the lump. Deliver poison once daily, entering from the stomach and curving into the large intestine, then expelling through the food passage, removing the impure and retaining the pure. Caution is advised in maintaining the original yang, and one must avoid anger and irritability. The above method should be performed seven times in a day and night, and it will naturally dissipate without a trace.

    Additionally: Visualize a tendon at the affected spot. Use the left hand on the right side and the right hand on the left side, pulling it down into the abdomen. If the scrofula causes pain, then pull it down from the soles of the feet.[143p]

    　　　　医案

    　　《本事方》曰：有人患颈筋急项不得转侧，自午后发，至黄昏时定。予曰：此患必从足起，盖足太阳之筋，自足至项。大抵筋者肝之合也；日中至黄昏，天之阳，阳中之阴也。又曰：阴中之阳，肺也。自离至兑，阴旺阳弱之时，故《灵宝毕法》云：离至干，肾气绝而肝气弱。肝肾二脏受阴气，故发于是时。授以木瓜煎方，三服而愈。[144p]

    Medical Case

    The text from "Ben Shi Fang" states: A person suffers from stiff neck muscles, unable to turn or tilt the head, starting in the afternoon and settling by dusk. I said: This ailment must originate from the feet, as the muscles of the solar channel extend from the feet to the neck. Generally, the muscles are associated with the liver; from noon to dusk, it is the time of yang, and within yang, there is yin. Furthermore, within yin, there is yang, which pertains to the lungs. From Li to Dui, it is a time when yin is abundant and yang is weak, thus "Ling Bao Bi Fa" states: From Li to Gan, the kidney energy is exhausted while the liver energy is weak. Both the liver and kidney organs are affected by yin energy, hence the onset occurs at this time. I prescribed a brew of papaya, and after three doses, the patient recovered.[144p]

    　　一人患项筋痛连背胛，不可转移，服诸风药皆不效。予忆《千金髓》有肾气攻背强一证，与椒附散一服，差。盖肾气自腰挟脊，上项至曹溪穴，然后入泥丸宫。曹溪穴非精于搬运者不能透。今逆行至此不得通，用椒以引归经则安矣。气上逆，椒下达，故服之即愈。
    　　《儒门事亲》曰：戴人在西华寄于夏官人宅，忽项上病一疮，状如白头疮，肿根红硬，以其微小不虑也。忽遇一故人见邀，饮以羊膏酒，鸡鱼盐蒜皆在焉。戴人以其故旧不能辞，又忘其禁忌，是夜疮疼痛不可忍，项肿及头，口发狂言，目见鬼神。夏君甚惧，欲报其家。戴人笑曰：请无虑，来日当平。乃以酒调通经散六七钱，下舟车丸百余粒，次以热面羹投之，上涌下泄，一时齐作，合去半盆，明日日中疮肿已平，一二日肿消而愈。夏君见，大奇之。[145p]

    A person suffering from pain in the neck and back, unable to move, found no relief from various wind medicines. I recalled a case in "Thousand Gold Essence" regarding kidney energy attacking the back, which was treated with a dose of Pepper and Deer Antler Powder, yielding some effect. It appears that the kidney energy, originating from the waist, travels up the spine to the Cao Xi point, and then enters the Mijing Palace. The Cao Xi point cannot be penetrated unless one is skilled in manipulation. Since it is stuck and cannot continue along this path, using pepper to guide it back into the channels will bring relief. The energy ascends and is countered by the downward action of the pepper, thus taking it results in healing.

    In "The Confucian Way of Serving Parents," it is recorded that a man named Dai was staying with the official in the West Hua area when suddenly a sore appeared on his neck, resembling a whitehead, with a swollen, hard red base. He initially disregarded it due to its small size. Unexpectedly, he encountered an old friend who invited him to drink sheep fat wine along with chicken, fish, salt, and garlic. Dai, unable to refuse due to their friendship and forgetting his dietary restrictions, found that night unbearable due to the pain from the sore, which swelled to his head, causing him to speak irrationally and see ghosts and spirits. The official, Xia, was extremely alarmed and wanted to report it to Dai's family. Dai laughed and said, “Please don’t worry; tomorrow it will be fine.” He then mixed wine with Tongjing Powder, taking six or seven qian, along with more than a hundred pills of boat and vehicle essence, and followed this with a hot flour soup. This triggered a strong reaction, both upward and downward, resulting in a large release, filling half a basin. By noon the next day, the swelling of the sore had subsided, and in one or two days, it completely healed. Xia was greatly astonished by this outcome.[145p]

    　　一妇人病瘰疬，延及胸臆，皆成大疮，相连无好皮肉，求戴人疗之。戴人曰：火淫所胜，治以咸寒。命以沧盐吐之，一吐而着痂；次用凉膈散、解毒汤等剂，皮肉乃复如初。
    　　《丹溪心法》曰：一男子项强不能回顾，动则微痛，其脉弦而数实。右手为甚，作痰客太阳经治之，用二陈汤加酒洗黄芩、羌活、红花，服后二日愈。
    　　《薛己医案》曰：儒者杨泽之，性躁嗜色，缺盆结一核，此肝火血燥筋挛，法当滋肾水，生肝血。不信，乃内服降火化痰之药，外敷南星、商陆，转大如碗。余用补中益气及六味地黄，间以芦荟丸，年余，元气复而肿消。[146p]

    A woman fell ill with scrofula, which spread to her chest and formed large sores, leaving no healthy flesh. She sought the help of a healer. The healer said: "This is caused by excessive fire; treat it with something cool and salty." He instructed her to take long salt to induce vomiting, and after one vomit, her sores began to form scabs. Subsequently, he used cool decoctions and detoxifying soups, and her flesh gradually returned to normal.

    The "Danxi Heart Method" states: A man had a stiff neck and could not turn his head; movement caused slight pain, and his pulse was tight and rapid. His right side was worse. For phlegm obstructing the sun meridian, he used Erchen Decoction with wine to wash Huangqin, Qianghuo, and Honghua, and after taking it for two days, he was cured.

    The "Xue Ji Medical Records" notes: A scholar, Yang Zezhi, had a restless nature and a craving for lust, resulting in a testicular growth. This was due to liver fire and blood dryness causing muscle spasms. The treatment should nourish kidney water to generate liver blood. Disbelieving this, he took internal medicines to reduce fire and resolve phlegm, applying Nanshen and Shanglu externally, which caused it to swell as large as a bowl. I used remedies to tonify the middle and benefit Qi, along with Liuwei Dihuang, interspersed with Aloe pills, and after a year, his vital energy was restored and the swelling disappeared.[146p]

    　　一男子素善怒，左项微肿，渐大如升，用清痰理气，大热作渴，小便频浊。余谓肾水亏损，用六味地黄、补中益气而愈。亦有胸胁等处，大如升斗，或破而如菌如榴，不问大小，俱治以前法。
    　　举人江节夫颈臂胁肋各结一核，恪服祛痰降火软坚之剂，益甚。余曰：此肝胆经血少而火燥也。彼执前药，至明年六月，各核皆溃，脉浮大而濇。余断以秋金将旺，肝木被克，必不起。后果然。
    　　阁老杨石斋子，年十七，患疬，发热作渴，日晡颊赤，左关尺脉大而浮，此肝肾阴虚，用补阴八珍汤二十余剂，又加参、芪二十余剂而溃。但脓水清稀，肌肉不生，乃以参、芪、归、朮为主，佐以芍药、熟地、麦冬、五味，脓水稠而肌肉生；更服必效散一剂，疬毒去而疮口敛。[147p]

    A man who was naturally prone to anger had a slight swelling on his left neck, which gradually grew larger like a gourd. He persisted with the previous medicines, and by June of the following year, all knots had ruptured, with a pulse that was floating and large. I concluded that autumn's metal would become strong, while the liver's wood was being restrained, leading to no improvement. Eventually, this prediction came true.

    The son of the old minister Yang Shizhai, aged seventeen, suffered from tuberculosis, experiencing fever and thirst, with red cheeks in the afternoon and a large, floating pulse at the left wrist. This indicated a deficiency of liver and kidney yin. I prescribed Ba Zhen Tang for more than twenty doses, adding Ren Shen and Huang Qi for over twenty more doses, but it just ruptured. However, the pus was clear and watery, with no muscle growth. Thus, I focused on Ren Shen, Huang Qi, Bai Zhu, and combined them with Shao Yao, Shu Di, Mai Dong, and Wu Wei, which made the pus thicker and facilitated muscle growth. I then prescribed another effective remedy, which cleared the tuberculosis poison and helped the sores to close.[147p]

    　　一儒者患愈后，体瘦发热，昼夜无定，此足三阴气血俱虚，用八珍加麦冬、五味二十余剂，又用补中益气加麦冬、五味，及六味丸而愈。
    　　儒者张子容素善怒，患瘰疬久而不愈。疮出鲜血，左关弦洪，重按如无，此肝火动而血妄行，证属气血俱虚，用补中益气以补脾肺，六味丸以滋肾肝而愈。
    　　一人耳下患结核五枚，经年许尚硬，面色痿黄，饮食不甘，劳而发热，脉数软而濇，以益气养荣汤六十余剂，元气已复，患处已消，一核尚存，以必效散二服而平。
    　　一人先于耳前耳下患之，将愈延及项侧缺盆，三年，遂延胸腋，诊之，肝脉弦数，以龙荟、散坚二丸治之。将愈，肝脉尚数，四年后，小腹阴囊内股皆患毒，年余不敛，脉诊如前，以清肝养血及前丸而愈。[148p]

    A Confucian scholar, after recovering from an illness, experienced weakness and fever, with irregularity day and night. This indicated a deficiency in the three yin energies, as well as in blood. He was treated with over twenty doses of the Eight Treasures decoction, adding Mai Dong and Wu Wei, and also with the Bu Zhong Yi Qi decoction, incorporating Mai Dong and Wu Wei, along with Liu Wei Wan, leading to recovery.

    One man had five hard tubercles below the ear for over a year; his complexion was sallow, appetite poor, and he experienced labor-induced fever. His pulse was rapid, soft, and weak.     　　一人因怒，耳下及缺盆患疬，溃延腋下，形气颇实，疮口不合，治以散肿溃坚而愈。
    　　一人因劳而患，怠惰发热，脉洪大，按之无力，宜用补中益气汤。彼不信，辄服攻伐之剂，吐泻不止而死。大抵此证原属虚损，若不审虚实而犯病禁经禁，鲜有不悞。常治先以调经解郁，更隔蒜灸之，多自消；如不消，即以琥珀膏贴之，候有脓则针之，否则变生他证。设若兼痰兼阴虚等证，只宜加兼证之剂，不可干扰余经。或气血已复而核不消，却服散坚之剂，至月余不应，气血亦不觉损，方进必效散，或遇神仙无比丸，其毒一下，即止二药。更服益气养荣汤数剂以调理。疮口不敛，豆豉饼、琥珀膏。若气血俱虚，或不慎饮食起居七情者，俱不治。然此证以气为主，气血壮实，不用追蚀之剂，彼亦能自腐，但取去使易于收敛。若气血虚不先用补，而数用追蚀之药，适足以取败。若发寒热，眼内有赤脉贯瞳人者不治，一脉者一年死，二脉者二年死。[149p]

    One person, due to anger, developed a sore beneath the ear that extended to the axilla, with significant swelling and a malodorous wound that would not close. Treatment involved dispersing the swelling and promoting drainage, resulting in recovery.

    Another person, due to overexertion, experienced fatigue with fever; the pulse was large and forceful, but weak upon palpation. It was appropriate to use the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction. However, he did not believe it and rashly took purgative medicines, leading to continuous vomiting and diarrhea, resulting in death. Generally, this condition was inherently one of deficiency; if one does not discern between deficiency and excess and violates the regulations regarding diseases, it is rare not to suffer dire consequences.

    Typically, treatment begins by regulating the menstrual cycle and relieving stagnation, and then using garlic moxibustion; many will resolve naturally. If not resolved, one should apply amber paste and, when there is pus, puncture it; otherwise, it may develop into another condition. If there are concomitant symptoms like phlegm or yin deficiency, one should only add agents for those symptoms and avoid interfering with other treatments.

    If the qi and blood have already recovered but the mass has not dissipated, using dispersive agents may be appropriate, even if it takes over a month without improvement—the qi and blood will not feel weakened. Then, dispersing agents may be applied. Alternatively, if one encounters medicinal pills of unmatched potency, if their toxicity is profound, both medications should be stopped. Next, a few doses of the Yi Qi Yang Rong Decoction can be used for adjustment.

    If the wound does not heal, one may use fermented soybean cakes or amber paste. If there is a deficiency in both qi and blood, or if one carelessly eats or has emotional disturbances, no treatment should be administered. Nonetheless, in this condition, qi is paramount; with robust qi and blood, it is unnecessary to pursue corrosive agents, as they can self-decompose, but one should ensure the process facilitates closure.

    If there is deficiency in qi and blood and one neglects to supplement first, while repeatedly using corrosive medicines, it is merely enough to invite failure. If there are chills and fever, and a red vein runs through the pupil of the eye, it should not be treated; if there is one vein, death occurs within a year; two veins indicate death within two years.[149p]

    　　一人患结核痰盛，胸膈痞闷，脾胃脉弦，此脾土虚肝木乘之也，当实脾土伐肝木为主。彼以治痰为先，乃服苦寒化痰药不应，又加破气药，病愈甚；始用六君子汤，加芎归数剂；饮食少思，以补中益气汤倍加白朮，月余中气少健；又以益气养荣汤，四月肿消而血气亦复矣。夫右关脉弦，弦属木，乃木盛克脾土，为贼邪也。虚而用苦寒之剂，是为虚虚。况痰之为病，其因不一，主治之法不同。凡治痰，利药过多则脾气愈虚，虚则痰愈易生。如中气不足，必用参朮之类为主，佐以痰药。[150p]

    A person suffering from tuberculosis had excessive phlegm, a feeling of fullness and heaviness in the chest, and a tight pulse in the spleen and stomach. This indicates a deficiency in the spleen (earth) and an excess of liver (wood) overpowering it. The treatment should focus on strengthening the spleen and countering the liver. This patient prioritized treating phlegm first, taking bitter and cold phlegm-transforming medicines, which were ineffective, and then additionally taking Qi-breaking medicines, worsening the condition. Initially, they used the Six Gentlemen Decoction, adding several doses of Szechuan lovage; with reduced appetite and thoughts, they supplemented with a modified Middle-Strengthening and Qi-Benefiting Decoction by doubling the amount of white atractylodes, which improved their energy over a month. Later, they employed the Qi-Benefiting and Nourishing Decoction, leading to a reduction in swelling and a return of blood and energy after four months.

    In this case, the tight pulse indicates an excess of wood, thus overpowering the spleen (earth) and acting as a harmful influence. Using bitter and cold medicines on a deficiency is a form of double deficiency. Moreover, phlegm can arise from various causes, necessitating different treatment methods. In general, when treating phlegm, excessive use of draining medicines can further weaken the spleen Qi, making phlegm easier to generate. If there is insufficient middle Qi, one must primarily use ginseng and atractylodes, supplemented by phlegm medicines.[150p]

    　　一人久患不敛，神思困倦，脉虚，予欲投以托里，彼以为迂，乃服散肿溃坚汤，半月余，果发热，饮食愈少，复求治。予以益气养荣汤三月。喜其谨守禁忌，故得以收效。齐氏曰：结核瘰疬，初觉宜内消之。如经久而除，气血渐衰，肌寒肉冷，或脓汁清稀，毒气不出，疮口不合，聚肿不赤，结核无脓，外证不明者，并宜托里。脓未成者，使脓早成。脓已溃者，使新肉早生。血气虚者，托里补之。阴阳不和，托里调之。大抵托里之法，使疮无变坏之证，此所以宜用也。
    　　一妇患瘰疬，延至胸腋，脓水淋漓，日久五心烦热，肢体疼痛，头目昏重，心忪颊赤，口干咽燥，发热盗汗，食少嗜卧，月水不调，脐腹作痛。予谓血虚而然，非疬故也。服逍遥散月余，少可；更服八珍汤加牡丹皮、香附子，又月余而经通；再加黄芪、白蔹，两月余而愈。
    　　一妇溃后核不腐，以益气养荣汤三十余剂，更敷针头散腐之，再与前汤三十余剂而敛。[151p]

    A person suffered from a long-term illness with no signs of recovery; their mind was exhausted, and their pulse was weak. If it has persisted for a long time and the vital energy and blood are gradually declining, with cold muscles and chilled flesh, or with clear and thin pus, and toxic substances not expelled, with ulcer openings not closed, masses not red, and tubercles without pus, and the external symptoms unclear, "Tuo Li" treatment should be used. If pus has not formed, it should promote early pus formation. If pus has already discharged, it should encourage the rapid growth of new flesh. If blood and energy are deficient, "Tuo Li" should replenish them. If yin and yang are unbalanced, "Tuo Li" should adjust them. Generally, the method of "Tuo Li" ensures that ulcers do not exhibit signs of deterioration; this is why its use is advocated.

    A woman had lymphadenopathy that extended to her chest and armpits, with pus and fluid oozing persistently.     　　一妇久溃发热，月经过期且少，用逍遥散，兼益气养荣汤，两月余，气血复而疮亦愈。但一口不收，敷针头散，更灸肩井穴而痊。
    　　一妇瘰疬，与养血顺气药不应，服神效瓜蒌散二剂，顿退，又六剂而消却；与托里药，气血平复而愈。
    　　一妇人瘰疬久不愈，或以木旺之证，用散肿溃坚汤伐之，肿硬益甚。予以为肝经气血亏损，当滋化源，用六味地黄丸、补中益气汤，至春而愈。此证若肝经风火暴病，元气无亏，宜用前汤。若风木旺而自病，宜用泻青丸，虚者用地黄丸。若水不能生木，亦用此丸。若金来克木，宜补脾土，生肾水。大凡风木之病，壮脾土则木自不能克矣。若行伐肝，别脾胃先伤，而木反克土矣。
    　　一妇患瘰疬，少寐，年余疬破，脓水淋漓，经水或五十日或两月余一至，误服通经丸，展转无寐，午前恶寒，午后发热，予以为思虑亏损脾血，用归脾汤作丸，午前以六君送下，午后以逍遥送下，两月余得寐，半载后经行如期，年余疮愈。[152p]

    A woman suffering from lymphatic swellings had poor sleep for over a year. The lesions burst and oozed pus.     　　一妇瘰疬后，遍身作痒，脉大，按之则虚，以十全大补汤，加香附治之而愈。大凡溃后，午前痒作气虚，午后痒作血虚，若作风证治之，必死。
    　　一男子患此，肿痛发寒热，大便秘，以射干连翘散六剂，热退大半，以仙方活命饮四剂而消。
    　　一妇人耳下肿痛发寒热，与荆防败毒散四剂，表证悉退；以散肿溃坚汤数剂。肿消大半；再以神效栝蒌散四剂而平。
    　　一男子肝经风热，耳下肿痛发热，脉浮数，以薄荷丹治之而消。
    　　一男子每怒耳下肿，胁或作痛，以小柴胡汤，加青皮、木香、红花、桃仁，四剂而愈。
    　　一男子颈肿不作脓，脉弦而数，以小柴胡汤兼神效瓜蒌散各数剂，及隔蒜灸数次，月余而消。
    　　一妇人颈肿不消，与神效栝蒌散六剂，少退；更以小柴胡汤，加青皮、枳壳、贝母数剂，消大半；再以四物对小柴胡数剂而平。[153p]

    A woman developed itching all over her body after suffering from a tuberculosis-like condition. Her pulse was large but weak upon palpation. She was treated with a complete tonic decoction and added Xiangfu, leading to recovery.     　　一男子因暴怒，项下肿痛，生结核，痞闷兼发热，用方脉流气二剂，胸膈利；以荆防败毒散二剂而热退；肝脉尚弦濇，以小柴胡加芎、归、芍药四剂，脉证顿退；以散肿溃坚丸一料，将平，惟一核不消，乃服遇仙无比丸二两而瘳。
    　　一妇人久郁患此，溃而不敛，发热口干，月水短少，饮食无味，日晡尤倦，以益气养荣汤二十余剂少健。余谓须服百剂，庶保无虞。彼欲求速效，反服螌蝥之剂，及数用追蚀毒药，去而复结，以致不能收敛，出水不止，遂致不救。盖此证属虚劳气郁所致，宜补形气调经脉，未成者消，已成者溃。若投慓悍之剂，则气血愈虚，多变为瘵证。彼坚而不溃，溃而不合，气血不足明矣，况二经之血，原自不足，不可不察。
    　　一男子患久不敛，脓出更清，面黄羸瘦，每侵晨作泻，与二神丸数服，泻止；更以六君子汤加芎归，月余肌体渐复；灸以豆豉饼，及用补剂作膏药贴之，三月余而痊。[154p]

    A man, due to extreme anger, developed swelling and pain under his jaw, leading to tuberculosis and feelings of oppression along with fever.     　　一男子患此，未溃，倦怠发热，以补中益气汤治之，少愈；以益气养荣汤月余而溃；又月余而瘥。
    　　一妇人肝经积热，患此作痛，脉沉数，以麝香连翘汤四剂，少愈；用散肿溃坚丸月余而消。丹溪云：瘰疬必起于足少阳一经，不守禁忌，延及足阳明经，食味之厚，郁气之久，曰毒、曰风、曰热，皆此数端招引变换，须分虚实，实者易治，虚者可虑。此经主决断，有相火，且气多血少，妇人见此，若月水不调，寒热变生，稍久转为潮热，自非断欲食淡，神医不能疗也。
    　　一男子患而肿硬，久不消，亦不作脓，服散坚败毒药，不应；令灸肘尖、肩尖二穴；更服益气养荣汤，月余而消。

    A man suffered from this condition, which had not yet ulcerated, feeling fatigued and experiencing fever.     　　一室女年十七，项下时或作痛，乍寒乍热，如疟状，肝脉弦长，此血盛之证也。先以小柴胡汤二剂，少愈；更以生地黄丸治之而痊。《妇人良方》云：寡妇之病，自古未有言者，惟仓公传与褚澄论言及寡妇独阴无阳，欲男子而不可得，是以郁悒而成病也。《易》曰：天地絪缊，万物化醇；男女媾精，万物化生。孤阳独阴可乎？夫既处闺门，欲心萌而不遂，致阴阳交争，乍寒乍热，有类疟疾，久而为痨。又有经闭，白淫，痰逆，头风，膈气，痞闷，面(黑干)，瘦瘠等证，皆寡妇之病，诊其脉，独肝脉弦出寸口而上鱼际。究其脉，原其疾，皆血盛而得。经云：男子精盛则思室，女人血盛则怀胎。观其精血，思过半矣。
    　　一妇人患久不作脓，脉浮而溜，予以气血俱虚欲补之，便自溃。彼欲内消，专服螌蝥及散坚之药，气血愈虚而死。
    　　一男子素弱，溃后核不腐，此气血皆虚，用托里养荣汤，气血将复，核尚在，以簪挺拨去，又服煎药月余而痊。[156p]

    A young woman, aged seventeen, experienced occasional pain under her jaw, with symptoms fluctuating between cold and hot, resembling malaria. Her liver pulse was strong and long, indicating an abundance of blood.     The "Good Prescriptions for Women" states that there has been no mention of the ailments of widows in the past. Only the writings of Cang Gong and discussions with Zhu Cheng touch upon how a widow, being solely yin without yang, desires a man but cannot obtain one, leading to depression and resulting in illness. The "I Ching" states: "As heaven and earth intertwine, all things transform; when male and female unite, all things are born." Can there be a solitary yang without yin? When one is confined within the boudoir, unfulfilled desires lead to a struggle between yin and yang, with symptoms alternating between cold and hot, resembling malaria, which can eventually lead to tuberculosis.

The classics say: "When a man's essence is vigorous, he thinks of a household, but when a woman's blood is abundant, she conceives." Observing this essence and blood indicates the matter is more than halfway understood.

    　　一男子气血已复，核尚不腐，用针头散及必效散各三次，不旬日而愈。
    　　一妇人因怒，项肿，后月经不通，四肢浮肿，小便如淋，此血分证也。先以椒仁丸数服，经行肿消；更以六君子汤加柴胡、枳壳，数日颈肿亦消矣。亦有先因小便不利，后身发肿致经水不通，名曰水分，宜葶苈丸治之。《妇人良方》云：妇人肿满，若先因经水断绝，后至四肢浮肿小便不通，名曰血分。水化为血，血不通则复化为水矣。宜服椒仁丸。若先因小便不利，后身浮肿，致经水不通，名曰水分，宜服葶苈丸。
    　　一室女年十九，颈肿而面色不变，肌肉日削，筋挛急痛，此七情所伤，血气皆损之证也，当先滋养血气。彼不信，乃服风药，后果不起。卢砥镜曰：经云：神伤于思虑则肉脱，意伤于忧愁则肢废，魂伤于悲哀则筋挛，魄伤于喜乐则皮槁，志伤于盛怒则腰脊难以俯仰也。

    　　一室女性急好怒，耳下常肿痛，发寒热，肝脉弦急，投以小柴胡汤，加青皮、牛蒡子、荆芥、防风治之而寒热退；更以小柴胡汤对四物数剂而肿消。其父欲除去病根，勿令再发。予谓肝内主藏血，外主荣筋，若恚怒气逆则伤肝，肝主筋，故蓄结而为肿。须病者自能调摄，庶可免患。否则肝迭受伤，则不能藏血，血虚则为难瘥之证矣。后不戒，果结三核，屡用追蚀药，不敛而殁。
    　　一少妇耳下患肿，素勤苦，发热口干，月水每过期而至且少。老媪以为经闭，用水蛭之类通之，以致愈虚而毙。夫月水之为物，乃手太阳手太阴二经主之，此二经相为表里，主上为乳汁，下为月水，为经络之余气。苟外无六淫所侵，内无七情所伤，脾胃之气壮，则冲任之气盛，故为月水适时而至。然而面色痿黄，四肢消瘦，发热口干，月水过期且少，乃阴血不足也，非有余瘀闭之证。宜以滋养血气之剂徐徐培之，则经气盛而经水自依时而下。[158p]

    A woman in a room is often anxious and angry, experiencing swelling and pain under her ears, with chills and fevers. Her liver pulse is tense and rapid. I administered Xiao Chai Hu Decoction, adding Qing Pi, Niu Bang Zi, Jing Jie, and Fang Feng, which alleviated the chills and fevers.     A young woman suffered swelling under her ears, had a hardworking nature, and experienced fevers and dry mouth. Her menstrual flow was always late and sparse. An old woman believed it was due to menstrual blockage and used leeches to treat it, which only led to further deficiency and death. The menstrual flow is governed by the Hand Taiyang and Hand Taiyin meridians. These two connections regulate one another, with the upper governing breast milk and the lower governing menstrual flow, representing the residual energy of the meridians. If there are no external invasions from the six excesses and no internal injuries from the seven emotions, and if the spleen and stomach are strong, then the qi of the Chong and Ren meridians is robust, making the menstrual flow arrive punctually. However, with a sallow complexion, thin limbs, fevers, dry mouth, and delayed and scant menstrual flow, it indicates a deficiency of yin blood, not an excess or blockage. It is advisable to gradually nourish the blood and qi with suitable remedies, allowing the menstrual energy to flourish and the flow to resume its normal timing.[158p]

    　　一放出宫女，年逾三十，两胯作痛，不肿，色不变，大小便作痛如淋，登厕尤痛，此瘀血渍入隧道为患，乃男女失合之证也，难治。后溃不敛，又患瘰疬而殁。此妇为吾乡汤氏妾，汤为商，常在外，可见此妇在内，久怀幽郁，及在外又不能如愿，是以致此疾。愈见流注瘰疬，乃七情气血，皆已损伤，不可用攻伐之剂皎然矣。故精血篇云：精未通而御女以通其精，则五体有不满之处，异日有难状之疾。阴已痿而思色以降其精，精不出而内败，小便道濇而为淋。精已耗而复竭之，则大小便道牵疼，愈疼则愈欲大小便，愈便则愈疼。若女人天癸既至，逾十年无男子合则不调；未逾十年，思男子合，亦令不调，不调则旧血不出，新血悞行，或渍而入骨，或变而为肿，或虽合而亦难子。合男子多则精枯虚人，产乳众则血枯杀人。观其精血，思过半矣。[159p]

    Upon releasing a palace maid, aged over thirty, she experiences pain in her hips, without swelling or discoloration. The worsening condition with abscesses suggests that both emotional state and bodily fluids have been compromised, making aggressive treatments inappropriate. Thus, the "Essence and Blood" chapter states: if one engages with a woman without having fully circulated the essence, there will be unmet places in the body, leading to future ailments. If the yin is diminished but one still longs for sexual interaction to release the essence, the essence fails to exit and the body deteriorates. The urinary channel becomes obstructed, causing painful urination. As the essence is consumed and exhausted, the pathways for urination and defecation become more painful, leading to an increased urge, which in turn heightens the pain. If a woman, upon reaching her menstrual prime, does not have a male partner for over ten years, her condition will be unbalanced; if it has been less than ten years and she desires a partner, it will also cause imbalance. When imbalances occur, old blood will not flow out and new blood will stagnate, possibly seeping into the bones, causing swelling, or even making conception difficult despite coupling. Frequent male interactions may lead to an exhaustion of essence, and excessive lactation can deplete blood, threatening life. Observing her essence and blood, we can see that the situation is already quite severe.[159p]

    　　一室女年十七，患瘰疬，久不愈，月水尚未通，发热咳嗽，饮食不思。有老媪欲用巴豆、肉桂之类，先通其经。予谓此证潮热经候不调者不治，但喜脉不濇且不潮热，尚可治。须养气血，益津液，其经自行。彼悞于速效之说仍用之。予曰：非其治也。此类乃慓悍之剂，大助阳火，阴血得之则妄行，脾胃得之则愈虚。经果通而不止，饮食愈少，更加潮热，遂致不救。经云：女子七岁肾气盛，齿更发长；二七天癸至，任脉通，太冲脉盛，月事以时下。然过期而不至，是为失常，必有所因。夫人之生以血气为本，人之病，未有不先伤气血者。妇女得之多伤于七情。世有室女童男，积想在心，思虑过当，多致劳损，男子则神色先散，女子则月水先闭。[160p]

    A young woman, seventeen years old, suffers from lumps for a long time, with her monthly cycle yet to commence. She experiences fever and cough, lacking appetite. An elderly woman wishes to use medicinal herbs like croton and cinnamon to open her channels first. I said that this condition of tidal fever and irregular menstruation should not be treated in such a manner; however, if the pulse is not weak and does not show signs of tidal fever, there is still hope for treatment. One must nourish the vital energy and blood, and replenish the bodily fluids, allowing the channels to naturally open. They insist on quick-acting remedies regardless. I said: “This is not the correct treatment.” Such methods are harsh remedies that greatly enhance yang fire; if the yin blood enters this state, it leads to chaotic movement, and if the spleen and stomach endure it, they become more deficient. The channels may open but will not stop, leading to decreased appetite, increased tidal fever, and ultimately resulting in irretrievable decline. The text states: "At seven years of age, a girl’s kidney energy is strong, and her teeth and hair grow long; by fourteen, the heavenly tide arrives, the ren channel opens, the tai chong pulse is vigorous, and the monthly cycle occurs regularly." However, when the time has passed without occurrence, it becomes abnormal and must have a cause. A woman’s life is based on vital energy and blood; when one becomes ill, it is invariably preceded by damage to these. Women often suffer from emotional strain. In the world, there are young women and men who harbor pent-up thoughts, excessive worry leading to strain, resulting in issues; men may display a drained look, while women may find their monthly cycles cease.[160p]

    何以致然？盖忧愁思虑则伤心，心伤则血逆竭，血逆竭则神色先散，而月水先闭也。火既受病，不能荣养其子，故不嗜食。脾既虚，则金气亏，故发咳嗽。水气绝，故四肢干。本气不充，故多怒，鬓发焦，筋骨痿。俟五脏传遍，然后死矣。此一种于劳中最难治，盖病起于五脏之中，无有已期，药力不可及也。若或自能改易心志，用药扶接，如此则可得九死一生。举此为例，其余诸方，可按脉与证而治之。张氏云：室女月水久不行，切不可用青蒿等凉剂。医家多以为室女血热，故以凉药解之。殊不知血得热则行，冷则凝，《养生必用方》言之甚详，此说大有理，不可不知。若经候微少，渐渐不通，手足骨肉烦疼赢瘦，渐生潮热，其脉微数，此由阴虚血弱，阳往乘之，小水不能灭盛火，火逼水涸，亡津液，当养水益阴，慎毋以毒药通之，宜柏子仁丸、泽兰丸。[161p]

    How can this be explained? It is because worry and contemplation harm the heart; when the heart is harmed, blood flows backwards and diminishes. When the blood flows backwards and diminishes, the spirit disperses, leading to the closing of the monthly flow. When fire is sick, it cannot nourish its offspring, thus losing its appetite. When the spleen is deficient, the metal energy is insufficient, leading to cough. When the water energy is exhausted, the limbs become dry. When the fundamental energy is not replenished, one becomes easily angered, the hair turns gray, and the muscles and bones weaken. One waits for the five organs to spread their conditions, and then one dies. This is a form of ailment within labor that is most difficult to treat, as the illness arises from within the five organs, with no clear end. The power of medicine cannot reach it. However, if one can adjust their mind and spirit and use medicine to support the recovery, then it is possible to achieve a narrow escape from death. This serves as an example. For the treatment of other ailments, one can diagnose based on pulse and symptoms. Zhang states: If a young woman’s monthly flow has not occurred for a long time, she must not use cooling agents like Artemisia. Many physicians believe that the blood of a young woman is hot and hence treat it with cooling medicines. What they do not understand is that blood flows when it is heated and coagulates when it is cold. "The Essential Formulas for Health Preservation" mentions this in great detail; this principle is very valid and should not be overlooked. If the cycle becomes slightly irregular and gradually becomes obstructed, with the bones and flesh of the hands and feet becoming painful and emaciated, and gradually producing tidal fever, and the pulse becomes thin and rapid, this is due to deficiency of yin and weakness of blood, with yang overpowering it. The small water cannot extinguish the strong fire, the fire pushes the water dry, and the essence is lost. It is necessary to nourish the water and increase yin; one must be cautious and not use toxic medicines to clear it, rather, one should consider Bai Zi Ren Wan and Ze Lan Wan.[161p]

    　　沈氏室患瘰疬，久而不消，自汗恶寒，此气血俱虚也，遂以十全大补汤月余而溃。然其核虽取，而疮口不敛，更灸以豆豉饼，仍与前药加乌药、香附，两月而愈。大抵坚而不溃，溃而不合，皆由气不足也。尝见患此疮者，疮口虽合而不加补，往往变为瘵证。以及赤脉贯睛，皆为死证。
    　　一妇人因怒，耳下肿痛，以荆防败毒散加连翘、黄芩四贴而愈。尝治此旬日不消者，以益气血药，及饮远志酒，其肿自消。若无脓者亦自溃。不戒忿怒者则难治。[162p]

    The Shen family had a problem with scrofula that persisted for a long time. They experienced spontaneous sweating and aversion to cold, indicating both qi and blood deficiency. After taking the Shiquan Dabu Decoction for about a month, it ruptured. However, even though the kernel was removed, the wound didn't close up. They then used moxibustion with a fermented bean cake and continued with the previous medication, adding costus root and cyperus, and it took two months to heal. Generally, if a wound is hard and does not rupture, or if it ruptures and does not heal, it is due to insufficient qi. I have seen cases where the wound, although it appeared to close, did not improve with nourishment, often turning into tuberculous lesions. Additionally, when there are red veins penetrating the eyes, it indicates a fatal condition.

    One woman, after becoming angered, developed swelling and pain below her ear. She was treated with Jing Fang Bai Du San, along with Lian Qiao and Huang Qin, and recovered. I have also treated cases where swelling persisted for ten days without improvement by using herbs to tonify qi and blood, along with a spirit wine made from遠志 (distant will) and the swelling resolved on its own. In cases without pus, it would also eventually rupture. If one does not refrain from anger, treatment becomes difficult.[162p]

    　　一妇人亦因怒，耳下焮肿，头痛寒热，与荆防败毒散加黄芩治之，表证悉退，但饮食少思，日晡发热。东垣云：虽有虚热，不可大攻，热去则寒生也。遂以小柴胡汤加地骨皮、川芎、当归、茯苓、白朮、陈皮，十余贴而愈。次年春，复坚硬不溃，来索方，予定八珍汤加香附、柴胡、地骨皮、桔梗，自制服之，至六七剂，以效延缓，仍服人参败毒散，势愈甚；又服流气饮，则盗汗发热，口干少食。至秋，复求治。诊视气血虚极，予辞不治，果殁。今人有疮疡，不审元气虚实，病在表里，便服败毒流气药，殊不知败毒散乃发表之药，果有表证，亦止宜一二服，多则元气反损，其毒愈甚，虽有人参，莫补其耗。流气饮乃耗血之剂，果气结膈满，亦止宜二三服，多则血气愈伤，反为败证，虽有芎归，难以倚仗。丹溪云：此不系膏粱丹毒之变，因虚劳气郁所致也。[163p]

    A woman, due to anger, developed swelling under her ears, a headache, and alternating chills and fevers. She was treated with Jingfang Baidu San, adding Huangqin, which addressed the surface symptoms; however, she had little appetite and experienced evening fevers. Dongyuan remarked: although there is false heat, it should not be attacked heavily; if the heat is removed, cold will arise. Thus, she was treated with Xiao Chai Hu Tang, adding Digupi, Chuanxiong, Danggui, Fuling, Bai Zhu, and Chenpi. After ten or more doses, she recovered.

    The next spring, her condition hardened without breaking, and she sought the formula again. It was prescribed as Ba Zhen Tang with Xiangfu, Chai Hu, Digupi, and Jiegeng, which she made herself. After six or seven doses, her condition improved, yet she continued taking Ren Shen Baidu San, which worsened her state. She also took Liuqi Yin, resulting in night sweats, fever, a dry mouth, and loss of appetite. By autumn, she sought treatment again. Upon diagnosis, her qi and blood were critically deficient. I advised against treatment, and she consequently passed away.

    Nowadays, when people have sores and ulcers, they do not examine the fundamental deficiency or excess of qi, nor the surface or internal condition; they simply take Baidu or Liuqi medicine, not realizing that Baidu San is for treating surface symptoms. If there are surface symptoms, only one or two doses should be taken; more can harm the original qi and worsen the toxicity. Though there is Ren Shen, it cannot replenish what is lost. Liuqi Yin is a depleting medicine; if the qi is bound and the chest feels full, only two or three doses are advisable; more can harm the blood and qi, resulting in a worsening condition, and although there is Xiong and Gui, they are not reliable. Danxi noted: this is not a transformation of rich foods or damp toxins, but is caused by deficiency and qi stagnation.[163p]

    　　一妇人患瘰疬不消，脓清不敛，予以八珍汤治之，少愈；忽肩背痛不能回顾，此膀胱经气郁所致，当以防风通气汤治之。盖膀胱之脉，始于目内眦，上额交巅，下耳角，复上顶至脑后，过风府，下项，走肩膊，一支下腰膂，是经气动则脊痛项强，腰似折，此非膀胱经证而何？彼乃云，瘰疬，胆经病也，其脉主行项侧，即是经火动而然。遂自服清肝降火之药，反致不食，痛甚。复请予诊其脉，胃气愈弱，先以四君子汤加陈皮、炒芍药、半夏、羌活、蔓荆子四剂，食进痛止；继以防风通气汤二剂而愈。[164p]

    A woman suffered from a persistent abscess that would not heal, with clear pus not drying up. I treated her with Ba Zhen Tang, and she improved slightly; however, she suddenly experienced pain in her shoulders and back, making it impossible for her to turn her head. This was caused by stagnation in the bladder meridian, and should be treated with Fang Feng Tong Qi Tang. The bladder meridian begins at the inner canthus of the eye, crosses the forehead to the crown, descends near the ears, and then continues to the back of the head, passing down the neck to the shoulders, and extends down to the lower back. When the meridian's energy is disturbed, it results in back pain and a stiff neck, which clearly indicates a bladder meridian issue.

    She insisted that the abscess was related to the gallbladder meridian and that its path affects the sides of the neck; this implies that there is fire disturbance in the meridian. She then took herbal medicine to clear the liver and reduce fire, which caused her to lose her appetite and experience severe pain. She requested that I examine her pulse again, and I found her stomach energy had become weaker.     　　田氏妇年逾三十，患瘰疬，已溃不愈，与八珍汤加柴胡、地骨皮、夏枯草、香附、贝母五十余贴，形气渐转，更与必效散二服，疮口遂合，惟气血未平；再用前药三十余剂而平。后田生执此散方，不问虚实，概以治人，殊不知方中螌蝥性毒，虽能专治瘰疬，多服则损元气。若气血实者，先用此下之，而投补剂或可愈。若虚而用下药，或追蚀药，瘀肉虽去，而疮口不合，反致难治。
    　　广东陈方伯子，远途劳倦发热，脉大无力，耳下患肿，此劳损证也，饮补中益气汤，自然热退肿消。若专攻毒，则有虚虚之祸。彼不听，服降火药及必效散，果吐泻不食而死。夫人劳倦则损气，气衰则火旺，火旺则乘其脾土，故倦怠而热，此元气伤也。丹溪云：宜补形气，调经脉，其疮自消。不可汗下。若不详脉证经络受病之异而辄下之，鲜不危矣。[165p]

    The woman of the Tian family, over thirty years of age, suffered from scrofula, which had ulcerated and failed to heal. Further, she was given Bi Xiao San in two doses, which allowed the ulcer to close, but her vitality and blood remained unbalanced. After taking an additional thirty doses of the previous medicine, her condition stabilized. Later, Tian Sheng relied on this formula indiscriminately to treat others, not differentiating between those who were weak or strong, completely unaware that the ingredients included certain toxic substances, which though effective in treating scrofula, could deplete vital energy if used excessively. If a patient had excess vitality and blood, it would be appropriate to first use this to purge, and then follow up with tonics for recovery. However, if the patient was weak and purgative medicine was applied, or if corrosive medicine was used, while the stagnant flesh might be removed, the ulcer would not close properly, leading to difficulties in treatment.

    In Guangdong, Chen Fangbo's son, after a long and exhausting journey, developed a fever with a weak, large pulse and swelling beneath the ear, indicative of strain damage. Administering a restorative formula known as Zhong Yi Qi Tang naturally helped reduce the fever and swelling. If one were to focus excessively on detoxification, it could lead to further weakness. Despite this warning, the patient took fire-reducing medicine and Bi Xiao San, ultimately leading to vomiting, diarrhea, and death by starvation. Strain and exhaustion diminish vitality; as vitality declines, fire surges. The surging fire harms the spleen's function, resulting in weariness and fever, a sign of injured vital energy. Danxi stated: one should restore vitality and balance the meridians; only then would the sores heal on their own. Sweating or purging should not be done. If one blindly applies purgatives without discerning the unique pulse conditions and meridian pathologies, danger is rarely avoided.[165p]

    　　汪中翰侄，年及二十，耳下患疬臖痛，左关脉数，此肝经风热所致，以荆防败毒散三贴，表证悉退，再与散肿溃坚丸，月愈而平复。
    　　一妇年二十，耳下结核，经水每过期，午后头痛，服头风药愈盛，予以八珍汤加柴胡、地骨皮二十余剂而愈。
    　　杨文魁，年逾三十，每劳心过度，颈肿发热，服败毒散愈盛，予以补中益气汤数剂而消。
    　　一疬妇溃后发热，烦躁作渴，脉大无力，此血虚而然也，以当归补血汤六剂顿退，又以圣愈汤数剂少健，更以八珍汤加贝母、远志三十余剂而敛。东垣云：发热恶热，大渴不止，烦躁肌热，不欲近衣，其脉洪大，按之无力，或目痛鼻干者，非白虎汤证也，此血虚发躁，当以当归补血汤主之。又有火郁而热者，如不能食而热，自汗气短者，虚也，以甘寒之剂，泻热补气；如能食而热，口舌干燥，大便难者，以辛苦大寒之剂下之，以泻火补水。[166p]

    　　一男子颈间结核大溃，予用栀子清肝火养肝血，益元气之药而愈。此证亦有大如升斗者，亦治以前药可愈。
    　　一儿七岁，项结二核，时发寒热，日久不愈，治以连翘丸而消。若患在面臂等处尤宜。此丸若溃而不敛，兼以托里之药治之。
    　　一儿项结一核，坚硬如疬，面色痿黄，饮食不甘，服托里药不应，此无辜疳毒也，以蟾酥丸治之而愈。若数服不消，按之转动，软而不痛者，内有虫如粉，急针出之。若不速去，则虫随气走，内蚀脏腑，不治。蟾蜍，夏月沟渠中取腹大不跳不鸣者，先取粪蛆一杓，置桶中，以尿浸之，桶近上令干，使蛆不得出，将蟾蜍扑死，投蛆中，任蛆食，次以新布袋包系，置水急处，浸一宿取出，瓦上焙，为末，入麝香一字，软饭丸如麻子大，每服二三十丸，空心米饮服之。[167p]

    To obtain toads, catch those that are large and do not jump or croak from ditches in the summer. First, take a scoop of maggots and place it in a bucket, soaking it in urine. Keep the bucket dry at the top to prevent the maggots from escaping. Then, kill the toad and throw it into the maggot bucket, allowing the maggots to feed. Next, wrap it in a new cloth bag and place it in fast-moving water overnight. Take it out, bake it on a tile until powdered, adding a word of musk. Form the mixture into pills the size of sesame seeds, taking two or thirty pills each time with rice water on an empty stomach.[167p]

    　　一妇因怒不思食，发热倦怠，骨酸疼，体瘦面黄，经渐不通，颈间结核，以逍遥散、八珍汤治之，少可；彼自悞服水蛭等药，血气愈虚，逐致不救。
    　　《外科正宗》曰：一男人项疽十余日，视其疮势颇甚，根连左右耳项并肿红赤臖热，脉浮而数，先用黄连消毒散二服，退其大势，根脚稍定；后用托里消毒散数服，不觉腐溃。但诊脉浮无力，询知患者年过五旬，久艰嗣息，房中又有妾，又多兼思虑，劳欲太过，损伤元气故也。又疮形势大，止能起发，不能培养为脓，更用十全大补汤加桔梗、白芷，倍人参、白朮各三钱；外用桑木灸法，早晚二次灸之；又涂紫霞膏数日，患者头面俱肿，双目合缝，形状可畏，然后腐溃并作，脓出日至数升，如此半月。[168p]

    A woman, due to anger, lost her appetite, experienced fever and fatigue, had aching bones, became thin and pale, and her condition worsened.     The "Essentials of Surgery" states: A man suffered from a neck abscess for over ten days. Observing the severity of the wound, the roots extended towards both ears and the area was swollen, red, and hot, with a floating and rapid pulse. Initially, two doses of Huang Lian Xiao Du San were administered to reduce the seriousness, stabilizing the roots slightly. Later, several doses of Tuo Li Xiao Du San were given, yet it unexpectedly became necrotic. Upon examining the pulse, it was weak and floating. Inquiring about the patient revealed he was over fifty, had long struggled with fertility issues, had a concubine at home, and was burdened by excessive worry and overexertion, which harmed his vital energy. The size of the abscess was significant, merely able to erupt but unable to develop into pus. Therefore, a dose of Shi Quan Da Bu Tang was prescribed, adding Jie Geng and Bai Zhi, with double portions of Ren Shen and Bai Zhu, each three qian. Externally, the mulberry wood moxibustion method was used, applied twice daily; also, Zi Xia Ointment was applied for several days. The patient’s head and face were swollen, both eyes nearly shut; his condition became alarming. Eventually, the wound eroded and began to produce pus, yielding several liters over the course of half a month.[168p]

    用前药不胜其事，内加烦躁不宁，五心烦热，饮食渐少等证，此脓水出多，气血走泄，为虚火假证之故，随用圣愈汤一服，不应；又进一服加熟附子二钱方应，前证悉退。次以人参养荣汤加麦冬、五味，参、朮倍至三钱，调理月余。后至脑骨腐肉连发，片片脱下，其状狼狈，不可观瞻，凡相视者，无不点头惊讶。又恐腐溃深大，补不及事，每日粥食中用人参三钱，凡餐分入同煮食之，以补脾元，后方元气渐醒，调理四月方愈。彼后一年反生一子，以承后嗣也。[169p]

    When previous medicines could not manage the situation, accompanied by inner restlessness, five hearts in turmoil, and a gradual decrease in appetite, the excessive purulent discharge indicated a false manifestation of deficiency fire. There were fears that the decay was extensive and would not be restored in time. Therefore, in the daily congee, three qian of Ren Shen was used, with it included in every meal to strengthen the spleen’s essence. Gradually, the vital energy began to revive, and after four months of regulation, recovery was achieved. Later, a year passed and a son was born, securing the continuation of the lineage.[169p]

    　　一妇人正对口四五日，自灸廿余壮，竟不知痛，灸疤焦黑，平塌如故。诊之，脉微数而无力，此内虚证也。若假药力则悞其事，用铍针，当顶刺入寸许，不知痛，亦无血出，此毒滞而未发扬者，用蟾酥条插入针孔，每日一次，膏盖其上，至七日后，周围裂缝出脓血，内服纯补之药，至十四日落出疮根一块，指大，长寸余，后以玉红膏平长肌肉，又半月其口已平，以珍珠散掺上，即刻生皮而愈。此证设若不用针工，专假药力攻托，虽不至死，岂能得其速愈者哉？[170p]

    A woman had been enduring pain for four to five days, undergoing moxibustion over twenty times without realizing it was painful. The burn marks turned dark and flattened as usual. Upon examination, her pulse was weak, rapid, and without strength, indicating an internal deficiency. If one relied solely on medicinal potency, it would lead to distressing outcomes.     　　一监生项疮初起，请视，疮头偏于右半，不可轻待，必用艾灸为上。隔蒜灸至十五壮，知痛乃住。后彼视为小恙，失用内药。又四日，其疮复作，颈肿项强，红紫木痛，便秘，脉实有力，以内疏黄连汤加元明粉二钱，通其大便；次用消毒救苦汤二服，肿势仍甚，此内毒外发也，不可再消之，换服托里消毒散。至近二十日，因患者肥甚，外肉多紧，不作腐溃。予欲行针开放，彼家坚执强阻。岂后变证一出，烦闷昏愦，人事不省，彼方惊悔。随用铍针左右耳边并项之中，各开一窍，内有脓腐处，剪割寸许顽肉，放出内积瘀毒脓血，不止碗许。内服健脾胃、养气血、托里补虚之药，其脓似泉流不歇。每朝夕药与食中，共参六七钱，服至腐肉脱尽，新肉已生。又至四十日外，患者方得渐苏，始知人事，问其前由不知也。此患设若禁用针刀，不加峻补，岂有生乎？因其子见识道理，从信予言，未百日而痊。[171p]

    A patient with a newly emerging sore on the neck was examined. The sore was located more on the right side and should not be taken lightly; moxibustion was necessary.     　　一妇人四旬，肥甚，项疮五六日。视之，肉肿疮不肿，又兼口燥心烦，坚硬色紫，根脚散平，六脉洪大，此太过证也，后必无脓，相辞不治。彼又请医视之。有言外托者，又言内消者，有称年壮不妨，又说脉大易治。众人纷纷不定，仍各用药。又去七八日，前后胸项俱肿，木闷坚硬。仍复请视决之。予曰：此不治者，何也？初起，肉肿疮不肿，顶陷者，一也；根脚平散，真气内败，不能收束毒气，二也；口燥心烦，邪火内淫，三也；形色紫暗，血死毒滞，不作腐溃者，四也；六脉洪大，疮毒大盛，正气受克，无以抵当，故疮终变软陷，邪毒内攻而死者，五也。当备后事为要。此终于二十七朝前后足矣。后果至期而殁。于此言正理顺之病，可叹时人何为纷纷妄治也。[172p]

    A woman, aged four weeks, was very obese and had sores on her neck for five to six days. Some said it was an external issue, while others claimed it was internal consumption. Some remarked that her youthful age was not a hindrance, while others said a large pulse indicated easy treatment. The crowd was confused and each used their own remedies. After seven or eight days, her chest and neck both became swollen and hard. They again sought help for a decision. I said: This is untreatable; why? There are several reasons: first, the initial signs showed swollen flesh but no sore; second, the root and base were flat and dispersed, indicating a deficiency of true Qi unable to contain the toxic energy; third, a dry mouth and troubled heart indicated internal fire; fourth, a purple and dark appearance suggested stagnant blood and toxic accumulation with no tendency to ulcerate; fifth, the large pulse indicated that the toxic sore was flourishing, with the vital energy being overcome, leading to the eventual softening and sinking of the sore, followed by internal invasion of toxic heat leading to death.     　　一男子项疮五六日，就肆看视，头便黄色，根亦乎散。予曰：此当急治方可。彼面色不悦而去。又请里中医视之，乃曰：小恙也。因喜其说。用药又至五日外，其疮势坚硬，根脚开大，毒气已过两肩，流注前项，胸乳皆肿，呕吐恶心，寒热不食，疮势形色俱觉可畏，始信前言，复请予治。其疮形状，不可观也，此非药力可及。先用葱艾汤洗尽旧药，连煮药筒拔提二处，拔出瘀血碗余，随用银针斜斜插入根脚，透通患底数处，以蟾酥条插入孔内，此后解毒为脓，总以膏盖走散处，以真君妙贴散敷之，日渐日消，其毒收归后项原处；又兼服内托降火化痰之药三四日，候其大势已退，内脓已通，换服十全大补汤。凡坚而不化者照之，腐而不痛者取之，新而生迟者培之，如此调理，将近三月，方得完口平复。此为患者讳疾忌医之过，几乎至于丧命者多矣。[173p]

    A man had a sore on his neck for five or six days, and went to see it without taking much thought; his head turned yellow, and the root spread wide. I said, "This must be treated urgently."     　　一女人年过六旬，系宦族，素禀怯弱，项间患疽，初起头便如粟，谓里可容谷之病也。喜其形体不肥，虽发之后，必易于腐溃，此则不妨前说。先用隔蒜灸之，次用蟾酥饼贴灸上四边，以吸毒散敷之，收其根脚不散，内服托里消毒散数服，疮势坚硬，疼苦不止。予曰：到某日方止。况今疮不腐溃，诊其脉细数而无力，此内虚之故，不能解毒为脓，以疼为要，岂可得止？次换益气养荣汤加角针、白芷，三服肿亦渐起。外用桑木灸法，其坚渐软，脓出稠而不多。[174p]

    A woman in her sixties, hailing from a family of officials, was inherently timid and weak.     前方去角针、白芷加香附，倍用参、芪，又数服，方得脓溃，溃后痛亦不止。予曰：再三日午后，痛可止也。至期，腐肉将脱小半，临午用乳香定痛散一服，午后疼痛顿退，安睡不醒。患家欣悦。予曰：不然，此在用药适其时也。虽半月之言应于今刻，惟信则不失耳。后当某日腐尽，某日肌平，某日完口。此三者患家以墨绳记，候期日果实，并无过与不及也。此法要在眼力精巧，量病难易，新腐迟速，补助有无，用药合式，然后相量日数，可决于前，发之必中也。[175p]

    　　一妇壮年，项疮三日，其形径对前口，彼家相畏，人胖，不当疮发此穴也。予视顶高脚活，虽发不妨。彼欲内消之方妥。予曰：药消则不能，针消则可取。彼从之。用铍针当顶针入六七分，点至软肉方住，随去瘀血，又以蟾酥条插入孔内，服蟾酥丸，得大汗而解。次日，疮上微脓出之渐消，尤恐内毒未尽，又用消毒清热之药数服，不出十日而安。大抵凡欲消疮，先断根本，次泄毒气，使毒自衰，无得内攻为妙。[176p]

    A woman in her prime had a sore on her neck for three days, with its opening facing forward. Her family was fearful, as she was overweight, and this location was not typical for such a sore.     　　一男子耳后生疽十余日，自谓小恙不治，将近半月，根脚渐大，疮头惟流血水，稀恶污秽，四边紫黑，软陷无脓，面惨鼻掀，手冷气促，诊脉散大无根，此内败证也，何必治之？乱不用药。又延客医治之，固询无事。患者恨予不治，凡遇亲友，勉力支持，厉声自嘱，决不甘死。予曰：心不服死也，再五日必死。果然。予常观疮，但犯此证，虽山岳之躯，一败无不倾倒。

    　　一室女年十七，因父择婿不遂，躭至二旬，怀抱日久，项生数核，坚硬如石，此肝经凝结，筋缩之病也。又兼经水断绝，寒热如疟，咳嗽脉数，惟不颧红，此阴虚火动已成劳瘵证也，非药能愈。视其形状，喜无败色。予曰：欲治此病，先治其心犹可痊。父问曰：何药治心？予曰：非药也。《易》云：天地氤氲，万物化醇；男女媾精，万物化生。此天地男女生成化育之道也。斯病独起于孤阴寡阳，不生不化，所谓逆理之病。此女大失配，谓当至而不至，渐成失度之疾，其病不生而自生，非己作也，由时变也。[179p]

    A young woman, seventeen years old, experienced her father's failure in selecting a suitor, and as time elapsed, she became ill for over two months.
